reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have played this game for a long time, Long before it came out on Steam, and can say I love this game. It really helps bring back alot of Older Games I miss from when PC gaming was more than just a new Call of Duty Copy Paste every year. It reminds me Battlefield 1942 + The original Call of Duty + Medal of Honor allied Assault.

Its an awesome World War 2 experience Mixing all Aspects of the War. You have Fighter Planes, Tanks, Paratroopers, Snipers, Infantry, Gaurds, All kinds of weapon combinations and possibilities. You have freedom to do what you want and the open world Combat is great. The Game also Incorporates an RTS aspect were you can help control the outcome of the War by sending units you command into battles.

The Developers are really active with the Community. The Overall Community of the game is amazing, Probably the nicest community I have ever seen in a game. The Reddit, Forums, and Livestreamers alike are great places to talk to people.

Some people have come to steam to write bad reviews because maybe the latest update made them mad, or they didn't get to unlock recon in 1 day.  These people have missed the point. Your not supposed to unlock a new weapon every round like its call of duty.. The game is still in Beta and takes alot of Heat for that, but I have watched the game evolve over the years and Each Update it just keeps getting better. There will always be haters, But for a Free to Play game based on World War 2, This is an amazing experience.

I highly recommend that Everyone give Heroes and Generals a try, and All the people who have put in the Time.. Stop bashing the game so hard. You played 1,000 hours cause you had Fun , Otherwise you wouldn't have kept playing it.. If the latest update made you mad... take a break from the game, wait a month for the next update and you might be happy, But don't just crap on the game after 1,000 hours, Thats not fair. This is a damn good game and you all know it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Nazis riding bikes, 10/10 Best wargame of the year.

On a serious note it’s a decent game.
only problem is the matchmaking.
2/10 of the games i played where so unbalanced.. most of the time there were us, riding on bikes, vs the other team, with epic tank destroyers, we’d get our asses handed to us.

But remember that this is intentional. From the very beginning developers wanted H&G to be more like a real war. This game is not about fair battles, mirrored teams and kill to death ratio. It’s about taking what you get and using it to the best of your abilities. And if you want to influence battles even more you can become a general.

More often than not the game is unfair but it can be fun in it’s own way. It’s most certainly not for everyone though.

The way they made it is a far cry from how wars are fought you don’t give your soldiers inadequate gear and weapons then send them off to the slaughter and expect them to win you give them equipment that is better suited for the situation and is capable of standing some sort of a stance.

“Sir the enemy has a squad of tanks what should we do?”

“Well we have a ton a bikes… use those.”

“B-but sir!”

“Did I stutter? saddle up and peddle on out there son!”

The tanks vs bikes battles come to be because of the differences in sources that each faction has. From my understanding, the unbalance is partially caused by the people playing on the Axis side have had way more warfunds to buy resources with than the people in the Allied side. This causes the unbalance in battles and the one-sided wars that have occurred for some time now. Additionally, since the Axis side ends up wining more often, players switch factions and thus more players end up joining the Axis which doesn’t help much with the balance.

If you are on the Allied side, the above reason is the likely cause of the bikes vs tanks battles. Additionally, if you want to avoid these sort of battles when playing on either faction, when you click on “enter combat”, select “find mission” and when you click on a battle, you can view the resources available at that time. Choosing “random mission” matches you in a battle without taking resources into account.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is fun for the most part. But the extreme lack of balance and pay to win nature of it ruin the expirience. reviewText:
Early Access Review

I want to love this game I really do.

Before i start my review i just want to say one thing; Reto-Moto your game is in beta, this is the time to listen to your player base. Not time to go on a spree of adding a bunch of content that no one asked for. Fix your game before you start adding things you want.

This game has the potential to be one of the best WW2 FPS out there. The concept is there the physics are there (kind of) and the content is there, but all that potential is squandered by an absurdly lengthy grind and over priced items (greedy devs?).

This game is also unbalanced, but i did not include it above because i feel that is what can make it fun at times. You never know what you're going to be up against and you have to adapt to the situation, that's the element of realism. It's a strange ideology but that's what i feel.

How to improve the game:

1: Having a grind in a game is good, it what keeps people playing, but having too much of one is a bad thing because it will make people leave. So just make items a little less expensive and easier to unlock.

2: Improve the servers and performance of the game. this is not to prevalent of an issue but it's there and fixing this may entice people with lower end PCs to play your game (ie: warthunder).

3: Have more graphic options. This is more of a personal thing but we only have like three thing to change when it comes to visuals.

3: Take a break from adding content and fix the content you added. There are certain weapons/tanks/planes/cars that don't quite look/preform/feel right.

4: Fix the ugly and unresponsive menus. I know this is not just me because other people are complaining about it too. Just make it look better.

5: Pay attention to your player base. A Lot of companies are falling short of this recently and not listening to their community. This is how companies go bankrupt and lose all their fans.

And that's all she wrote. I have nothing else to say, i want to love this game, it has very thing i wanted from a game, the execution of those ideas was what ruined this game.

BUT! over all this is still in beta and i will keep hope on this game until it is complete (even though it's been about 2 years).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Levels 1-4 as a character in this game are great. It's totally a skill based matchup where you can go out and have a lot of fun. Once you (or any single one of your friends) hits level 5, the party is officially over. You immediately get thrown into much larger conflict against people who have a ton of weapons upgrades/vehicles that you don't have access to, and grinding levels becomes terrifying.

The gold purchasing in this game enables wallet warriors to reign supreme, and completely disenfranchizes those who don't have/want hundreds of dollars to go into a single game. This could be overcome with extreme patience and skill building, but pales in comparison to the revenue model of LoL (which maximizes fun, and doesn't require you to spend money).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't know how I got into this game. To be honest, I can't even remember going in. All I can remember is my character waking up on the second floor of an abandoned house just outside the town where I lived and that I was wearing some soldier's clothes. The name of the soldier was Karl Muller. I know this because I could read the name tag on the jacket. All this seemed very weird to me, but I decided to just go back home and figure out everything there. I needed to get out of those clothes; I didn’t want to be confused with someone else.

Just as I was walking down, I heard someone's whistle and an engine running outside the house. When I stepped outside, I saw a man wearing some weird looking green uniform running towards a funny looking green small vehicle and leaving. I decided to steal a bicycle that was sitting right in front of the house and went for a ride through the fields. I figured it was the shortest way home. As I was making my way along the river, I heard a loud noise in the woods and then a clicking noise (metal on metal) right afterwards. I got off the bike and took protection behind a tall tree and all I remember is that I was very scared. I took a minute to look around and see where that noise was coming from. Then, I saw it. It was that man wearing the green uniform. He was lying on the floor, had a really long rifle and he was looking down to a wooden barn across the field. It was a long way, but I saw some men running in and out of that barn. They were wearing a dark grey uniform (much like the one I was wearing) and looked desperate. It was almost as if they were running for their lives. Then the man shot another bullet with his rifle. It was so loud that I had to cover my ears. Then I looked towards the barn and saw one of those soldiers lying on the floor, motionless. The other soldiers were nowhere to be found and I remember feeling sorry for that guy. I asked myself- Why did this happened? Why? That sadness I felt for the guy quickly turned into anger, but to myself. I felt rage and resentment to my cowardly actions. This anger took control over myself and made me grab a shovel I had in my procession (don't know where it came from) and smashed it into that man's head. There was nothing he could do. I think it took one or two hits, but by the time I was done he was no longer part of this world. I grabbed his rifle and saw a complete different world through that scope. I saw tanks and loud fighter airplanes. I saw men in dark gray and green uniforms running everywhere. I saw them fighting over abandoned houses, bridges, and other sectors. I saw dead bodies flying several hundred meters up in the air. I saw a man on a motor bike running over three young soldiers and then exploding after hitting a tree. I saw smoke and heard loud explosions. All the things I saw, I saw them through the scope of this rifle. A rifle I DIDN'T pay for. Then I quickly realized that I was a real soldier and that I was sent to this Free to Play war to see all this epic things and to recommend this game to you.

There is a Free to Play soldier in all of us.

10/10 -Would steal your scopes, cars, bikes, and tanks from you again.

if you want to try it and at least pretend like you found the ww2 shooter your looking for, go for it, but for god sakes DONT GIVE THEM ANY MONEY!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Now some patches after introducing the Sowjet faction! (this is a pre-Walker, July 2015, build review, I edit when I notice considerable changes from what I pointed out below)

A game set in WW2 that appears to be as a dynamic, gamebalance-first, capture the point mission, fast-paced Arcade game, with sufficient historic assemblage (>Heroes). On top, there is real time strategy part, where you move your troops on the map and then zoom into the FPS battles (> Generals).
Sounds nice so far, that's why it attracted me in the first place.

There is a bit of overdramatizing following, but more than just the essence is true:

But the developer, despite claiming otherwise, extremly favors 1 hit kill Infantry camping play style, making the game a spawncamp game. No matter if you have a non-sniper class, just grab the >sniper< Bolt Action rifle and camp, preferably at the opponent spawnpoints.

The developer appears helpless of his own creation, finds no other way to balance his game towards his aim to have defenders win about 60% of the matches, resulting in frustrating gameplay.
Enemies kill you at sight (although there is an Arcade lifepoint system) and your own men prefer to sit in the woods as well, believe they are heavenly snipers and don't care about defending the cap points, taking or retaking them; mission objectives are failed. Not so dynamic... It's not the players' fault, they just accept what the designer offers.

To play it on some decent level at least you need to grind and the grind/farm factor for key items is ... well, let's say you have to spend a lot of money (€, $, etc.) instead.

The strategy part is out of balance due to the issue of an underpopulated faction, making the whole Generals part for the most populated faction a pain in the ***: German troops can easily stay 1-2 days (!) in the waiting queue while Soviet faction immediately deploys...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As much as I'd like to like this game (and I do), I can't support it due to several glaring problems.

The first is how expensive everything is.  It certainly strikes me as pay to win, it takes hours grinding up even individual mods, and to top it off, they depreceate and must be repaired, or special ammo types must be replenished.  It's a game that has too many rewards for paid players, and as someone who really has no problem spending money on games, the fact that it was trying to force me to do it so much turned me off pretty quickly.

There also seems to be a lack of guns, and moreso because beyond 2 guns you can get initially (the semi-automatic rifle or the smg) the rest are trapped behind paywalls or level-ups that will take days if not weeks to obtain.  Not enough choice beyond having a hamburger or a cheeseburger.

Finally, the matchmaking is very poor, and that's why I can't recommend the game.  Several times tonight I was put on teams with people rank 1-3 against people ranked 7+.  They clearly outgunned the teams, had access to things like tanks (when no one on my team even had access to anti-tank weapons), and could just camp objectives with tanks and we ended up losing very quickly.  When I first came to the game, the Nazi's lost 9 games in a row, even when I played as Nazi's and had k/d ratios of 5:1 (and pushing objectives).  The game isn't well balanced.

As far as positives, the combat itself is great.  A minimal HUD lends well to the long distance combat.  Shooting is difficult and takes patience, skill, and a steady hand.  The maps are well done and many times I had a great time fighting big battles over objectives, with a constant back and forth attack/defend going on in the domination style skirmish mode.  Even though you only get two weapons by default, both of them perform really well at their role, and seem well balanced.

All in all, this looked like such a great addition to the WW2 FPS style genre, but it really falls flat with balancing issues in matchmaker and pay to win access to skills and weapons.  As much as I want to love it, it still needs work.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe game is great fun when you get past the beginning levels, to a certain extent. At first, it is a very unique and exiciting shooter, having everyone roll out into an objective with a jeep, is pretty cool. After a couple of games, this starts to become repetitive and a bit tedious. The charge across road, hide in forest, capture objective, is a fairly solid idea however it quickly bores, in my opinion. Even when this is fun, which is 50% of the time, when you have an epic firefight across the forests and storm objectives, it does feel a bit tedious at times, you die drive another jeep in die, again and again and again. Despite this, it is great fun when everything in the game comes together, the tank crews rolling in, parachuters dropping down and airplanes bombing you this way and that. When all of these things occur at the same time it is great, and this happens quite often. However, there are a variety of factors that drag this down, not just because of game mechanics, but perhaps also because of the community and players. It gets annoying when you charge into an objective, get sniped, do it again, get sniped, do it again, get sniped and so on. Plenty of people are going to say, That's your own fault for being stupid HERDURR
date: the problem is,  there's not much else I can do as an infantry man. I can sit back and try and snipe people? But this isn't really a factor in this game. There's not much you can do but charge, machine gun and die, the marksman factor of this game exsists but it's not very effective, and there's no other gameplay mechanics that change this. An example I can use is Planetside 2 or Arma, where it is a perfectly reasonable option to just surround the objective and starve out your enemies, something that doesn't happen in this game. That might just be the way I feel about this game, but it is my review. Finally, in my big rant, there are times when I just want to smash my pc to pieces. There is nothing more annoying than a tank destroyer creeping around into the rear and blowing up every tank that spawns because the turrets are too slow to turn, and no one can blow up the enemy tank because anti tank items are too 'pay to win' and most people don't seem to even know about them.\n\nThe game has got a very large and annoying pay to win system, don't get me wrong it's a great game, graphics are great, gameplay is great, but pay to win and annoying tactics and repetition lets this game down, so overall I'd give it a 7.5/10. This is just what I've seen from the game, people may disagree but that's what I think.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well I gave it a good shot and played for 18 hours.

Damage:
You probably don't remember the days when Soldier of Fortune came out and you could literally blow the bad guys arms and legs off. Well I'm not looking for that, as there are kiddies present, but what I am looking for is some damage effect. Since when can a person get wounded by three or four bullets and still run, move and aim like a champion?

HUD:
So you've stealthfully walked, run, swam and crawled your way across half the map to capture a point and when you do a big circle appears over your head and tells every player on the map where you are. Almost as incoherent are the 'enemy spotted' tags which appear over your head if you ever dare fire your weapon. No matter how cleverly hidden you are, every enemy soldier on the map will see a nice red arrow pointing at you if you do. The only solution is to emulate the snipers who camp on top of a hill at the back of the action if you want to rack up the kills.

Tanks:
The tanks are seriously over powered which ruins it for anyone in the infantry. This could so easily be balanced with early access to anti-tank grenades.

Linear Warfare:
The main disappointment for me is the linear battles where you must take point A before point B before point C etc. This makes it far too easy for the enemy to park a tank at point B or just pound it endlessly with shells knowing that if we fail to take that one undefendable barn then the whole battle is over.

Conclusion:
What could well have been a great open world game is now a counter strike clone with tanks that take no damage from rocket launchers. Spawn, get sniped, spawn, get tanked, spawn and get shot by the guy hiding in the loft where you spawned. I almost gave in and was going to spend some money to buy a shovel but thought better of it. Play it for a while until the battle fatigue and shell shock sets in, even throw the devs a dollar or two, then go do something constructive.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Update since Adams Update:
There are 2 ways to play, FPS or RTS:
To the FPS side, there are 2 different types of battles, Staged and War

STAGED
Staged battles make each side have the same resources on each side so theoretically, each side has a fair chance of winning. It can be different everytime but there will always be infantry :P. Sometimes there may be medium tanks with planes or there can be light tanks with paratroopers etc. You can play as any of the 3 factions any time you want but each soldier has it's own equipment and level so choose wisely.

WAR
After a soldier reaches rank 12 or is a general, they can buy assault teams that affect the war and how it plays out. While you can do this, you are stuck with the faction you choose until the war is over and then you can swap. Playing war allows people to level up faster both by their actual level and their ribbons. In exchange for this bonus xp, the matches are much more... unpredictable. What resources you have will be dictated by the general's ATs that are fighting in that area. If you lose the battle, that area will be taken over by the other faction. If you win, you'll keep/takeover that area. Each battle is just part of a larger battlefield all across Europe with over 3000 different locations to fight for or to defend. The war ends when 15 major cities are taken over by a single faction.

HOW YOU WILL START
Most people with start with the FPS side (unless you buy a level 12+ soldier or a general). You will start playing encounter first with other new people which is a small, infantry only map. It only has one objective so it can be a tad bit hectic but it's only to help you get used to the game and they normally last about 5-10 minutes. Once you reach level 1, then you can start playing the smaller attack/defend maps. You will start to see the other types of classes in play now (recons, paratroopers and tanks (becareful of these buggers :P)). Once you reach level 5, you will be allowed to play the larger A/D maps and you will be introduced to planes (also avoid these buggers xD). You will also beable to play war batlles but I wouldn't advice it until you get better gear.

GOODS:
- Pay2NotGrind not Pay2Win (no one can really gain a definite advantage over you, skill will still reign supreme), I've seen people think they can win by paying money and see them do absolutely terrible with a MG42 xD I could kill them with a stock M1 Garand!
- Variety of weapons used (STG, M1/M2, PTDR, AVS-36 etc.)
- Different variety of maps (some are more CQC and others more open)
- Infantry, Tanks, Planes, Paratroopers, Recons (oh my!)
- Infantry Only Map! :D
- EVERYTHING CAN BE BOUGHT WITH INGAME CREDITS! (this includes Veteran (premium) Membership!)
- Anti tank weapons are found around the map so tanks can be destroyed even if you don't have AT nades or mines!
- Higher rank of your soldier, the more money he earns
- Modable weapons!
- Since Adams update, they've added a way for infantry to deal with planes WITH MOBILITY! :D
- The starter rifles have receieved a massive buff that puts them as one of the best weapons in the game currently if you use the right mods

BADS:
- Not very welcoming for new players (stuck on SA for a while...)
- Tanks and planes can be a problem if you don't have the right equipment
- Currently, Germany is the most populated faction with most of the vets, America is mostly full of the newbs, Soviets is least populated but I find it's an average player base
- YE GODZ THE GRIND IS GREAT
- Got to pay (either with ingame credits or gold) for the weapons you used (mods, ammo, the weapon itself...) but if you're smart, this cost shouldn't be much
- The maps can get a bit repetitive after a while but the devs have stated they have maps in development

Conclusion:
- It can be overwhelming at first but stay for the long run to have the best fun
- It's like a WW2 Battlefield"
- It encourages playing the objective and not K/D like COD
- You earn more money and xp for capping/defending the objective than just killing the enemy team
- Don't listen to the negative reviews by people with only 6 hours into this game
date: they just call BS reasons why you shouldn't play\n- They mentions hackers but in all of my 600 + hours
recommended: I have yet to encounter a hacker\n- Be smart
hoursPlayed: don't be a jimmy (Kotton reference :P)\n\nNow to ready up my M1903 and M1 Garand and kill lots of people :3"

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI played so much of this game in previous version updates and it wasn't the best, but it was super fun. I stopped playing the game a few updates ago when the completely redid the ribbons and badges and I wasted so much time that I spent working towards badges because of the badges being moved to other ribbons and ribbons being added. I was really mad before that, when an update got rid of ALL my modifications for my weapons and vehicle modifications, they all cost so much more than before, AND the mods did little to nothing save for a couple on most weapons (which, after, cost relatively more). I came back to this game this week and they changed a lot of things that I don't really mind too much. I went from a hardline connection to wifi  (now, 53 up/49 down) and can't run the game on LOW SETTINGS without lag or low fps, which didn't use to be the case. I realize it's wifi, but shouldn't it still work with a connection I generally have no problems with? I play higher quality games on medium settings AND can watch a stream without problems. This game used to be so much better than it is now—and even the super grinding was somewhat tolerable before. A year ago, I would have given this game a recommendation based on how fun it is for a free fps. Now, I would not recommend this game because the devs are taking it in the wrong direction and it's been practically abandoned as far as I can tell.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The idea and potential of this game are huge. The followthrough and direction it is going in are laughable.

For a game that's been in 'beta' now for YEARS, updates tend to give players new skins and small tweaks to maps like moving trees around. Over the coarse of the last year, only 1 new map has been released; this still puts this 4+ year BETA with less maps than BF1942 had as a free DEMO. Updates are roughly 2+ months apart and offer very little updating to content, depth, polish or gameplay but rather stupid broken mechanics or skins/camo.

The overall war mechanic is completely useless and boring. The combat is on the same 4-5 maps over and over and over and over. It doesn't matter if you're defending Berlin or fighting in some unnamed village - its the same map. Win the war? Who cares. A new one loads right after, everything goes back to as before, no bonuses or anything for winners/losers and its the same war with the same maps again and again and again.

At the rate this game is 'releasing' and the fact that the often incompetant development team is focused on adding in fluff and small mechanics to make this a P2W (or at least, pay to not grind endlessly) instead of actual content shows that the state this game is in currently will be what it looks like 1-2 years from now, with a few minor things added in/changed/patched/broken and then removed altogether again.

I'm looking forward to the next 'update' because I may get a scope for my shovel, some camo for my bicycle seat, ammunition that isn't an upgrade to anything and having a house on the airfrield map painted a diffferent color.

In short, this development team is dild@s.

New update: It is virtually impossible for you to earn more war credits in a game than what it cost to repair and refill ammo in just a single  game. Basically this means is it is impossible to progress through in the game without shelling out some real money. The issues with the game with new players still remain below.

Don't play this game, it is very unfirendly to new players. The community is very toxic towards new players as well, the 'vets' claim it's skill is why 'noobs get owned'. But if you happen to pick up a dead vets weapon then it becomes apparent that skill has nothing to do with it. I picked up a dead vets light machine gun and it was more accurate than my infantry standard bolt action rifle at long range. Clearly my score increased dramtically whenever I had the opputunity to pick up an upgraded weapon, so 'skill' as the toxic vets say is just their way of inflating their e-♥♥♥♥♥.

It doesn't help that the game throws you in the sharks pit once you hit lv 3 (roughly 5 hours gameplay). After level 3 you can be matched with anyone, this puts you at a severe disadvantage and you are forced to try and grind (performance based leveling up) vs oponents that are much better equiped than you are. If the xp you gain was fixed rarther performance based (kills etc) I would feel the need to try and slog through it. But it feels like you're trying to push sh*t uphill rarther than play the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a game I tried to avoid for months but then my friend said you can send people to the moon with 'nades, he was right....

So this is an amazing game I only played 5 hours and im in love with it. There's MANY things that need to be added, updated, fixed, and nerfed but trust me, it is alot of fun.
Here's a list of what needs to be fixed.

PROS:
-Lots of intense moments and BattleField like gameplay and strategy.
-VEHICLES!!! Seriously BattleField is not the only one to do this.
-Guns, and if that don't work, use more gun. Lots of guns though i only have 5 hours so i don't have them.
-TeamKilling your friends and sending them the moon.... There is a report button if they do teamkill.
-Big Teams for an all out Warfare in one little spot on the map.
-FORESTS THAT PEOPLE ACTUALLY GO IN!! :D    I had a 1v1 with a Nazi in the forest, he threw 'nades at me and I just shot him 'till i ran out and got a headshot and started moving on only to get blown up by a 'nade he dropped....
-Stealth??? I guess you could sneak up on the enemy by hiding in the bushes? My friend did.
-PlanetSide 2 real time war thingy.  There's a war thing where you pick a faction just like PlanetSide 2 and well yeah...
-Fences that may be torn apart with a magic item called A JEEP.
-Sort of like a realtime FPS i guess. You have to repair and re-load your weapons between battles with either In-game $ or IRL $$$ if you're a P2W. Also Repair Vehicles.
-Weight system!! I don't know how to describe it but it's amazing.
-Many WW2 jokes with friends, we are horrible people.....
-Day/Night cycle!!!

CONS:  (WARNING) There is alot of cons but remember, THIS IS EARLY ACCESS IT WILL HAVE CONS!!!
-Very high recoil with the Starting Rifles, just tone down the Recoil by like %10-%15 with Rifles
-Low EXP per round making leveling up sort of difficult : /
-No time limits to a game also when you join a battle you're stuck in it 'till it ends.. This *Jarate'd* me off last night -_-
-You get a bunch of $$$ after a match but after repairing you got 1 quarter of it to spend :(
-Because this game runs on a server i guess different from Steam, You have to add friends to invite them.
-Sometimes the guns don't make any sound upon shooting so i got absoulutly destroyed last night by ninjas : /
-You have to complete a challenge that takes a long time to get your first pistol and even then you need $$$ to get it
-Ribbons basically unlock gameplay. Yes, you need to get ribbons to get new stuff
-Jeeps that within 30 seconds of spawning turn into Party vans. (Too many people allowed on a jeep at once)
-No spawning on capture points that you control and are clear of any hostiles. Have fun walking into getting teamkilled.
-Slow crouch movement speed, it's almost as slow as prone but walking is like sprinting.
-Few things that require Gold ($$$ that is bought with $$$ from your wallet)
-The Gold Memberships are not permanent, like 1200 Gold=30 Day subscription just so you can get more EXP and more slots for weapons and equipment and such
-The turrets on Vehicles are really wonky and wavy it's almost impossible to aim straight with it.

So last thoughts: Really fun game with high potential and I hope it is successful. I hope there are more game modes, more maps, more servers other than the one Julian server, Easier EXP and $$$, more options for new players (pistol), and please let me spawn on captured points that are clear!! I suggest this game to BattleField fans looking for a nice WW2 themed game or anyone looking for WW2 stuff.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's fun with friends, but that's about it.  It really only takes you a day or two of playing to get access to tanks and planes, but then you're up against other people that have been playing longer (or paid) and have vehicles that stomp you.  As infantry, it's frustrating if no one on your team is playing as a pilot or tanker because it usually means that the entire team is nothing but BF-109's dropping bombs on you when you spawn or tanks sniping you from across the map.  The matchmaking is atrocious in this regard, not to mention how long it can take to get into a single match.  Also, I know it's more of an arcade shooter, but it's absolutely ridiculous that I need to use an entire Thompson magazine to kill a guy, or any more than one or two shots from a bolt-action rifle.

Plus, the recent Timoshenko update is terrible.  The Russians are horribly overpowered and you're pretty much guaranteed to lose against them - their weapons and vehicles do way more damage than the Americans or Germans and the Russians also get increased capture and spawn speeds.  Then you even have the lack of initiative the developers are taking against hackers.

Probably the worst of it all is there is shockingly little content for how long the game has been in development.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has some decent foundations, but you'll quickly realize it's just a clunky pay-to-win mess. Some of the mechanics are okay, some aren't; shooting is decent, hit detection is atrocious, and the sheer number of hits some people can survive is bizarre. Are people paying real money for armour that lets them become bullet tanks? I hate this game.

Red Orchestra 2 is better in just about every way; better shooting mechanics, hit detection, graphics, ambiance, gritty warzone feeling, spawning, capturing, everything. Red Orchestra 2 is the game to play if you're looking for WW2 combat. Everything you do in that game is a struggle for control of the battlefield and every kill, suppressing fire, and advance is satisfying and helpful for the entire team. Heroes and Generals completely fails to have that in-depth feel.

Strangely enough, I was excited that this game would be MMO and you could traverse the Western Front and choose where to battle, but you can't, it's not an MMO, it's just done in map instances. Even Red Orchestra 2 has more players per match. Way more. Play Red Orchestra 2 instead of this, you won't be let down.

Oh and, Heroes and Generals is pay-to-win. Enough said.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have played a lot of World War 2 games, but I have yet to play one that makes my efforts as a lowly foot soldier feel like piddly ♥♥♥♥.  I tried this game in early early closed alpha years ago, and I've tried it again to see what has changed.  I suppose for the ardent supporters, if they find something redeemable here, they might enjoy it.  I instead was greeted by cheesy mechanics rewarding one hit kills with bolt actions, ineffectual rifles, and an overall feeling of futility as I tried to do anything except die.  If you want to waste your bandwidth and try, by all means I welcome you to it.  This however, isn't a game I would recommend to friends.  The sheer progression for weapons is one of the absolute worst I have seen in a Free2Play game.  I have seen the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t Warframe pulls, and this pulls far far ahead.

Do you value that shiny PPsH all the Russians killed them Nazzys with?  Do you want to pay real money for a virtual gun, in an otherwise ♥♥♥♥ experience?  If the answer to the latter is no, do yourself a favor and just install Red Orchestra 2 and enjoy a game that encapsulates the horrors and adrenaline the Second World War exemplified.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nExperience with Game and Backstory"At the time I'm writing this review
date: I have a little over 300 hours invested in this game as a F2P member of the community. I have played the vast majority of this game on one character
hoursPlayed: that I swap to other classes once in a while to change it up
voteText: and then swap back to infantry afterwards.\n\nThe following details my lack of general satisfaction with the game and explains my opinion of it being mediocre. Let it be known that when I refer to the community in a negative light
helpfulPercent: I am not referring to anyone in particular or the whole community - only the select few that bring the group down. Although fun with friends
votesHelpful: this game brings nothing new to the table and is just another reskin of your standard F2P FPS model.\n\nTeamwork is Hard to FindThis game is highly repetitive
votesTotal: slow to add new content
votesFunny: and mostly a zerging experience due to lack of coordination in a match even in the presence of a squad leader. There are no voice comms
commentsCount: which would be a downside
column16: but due to the overall cancerous chat I've encountered in nearly every game and everyone wanting to be the hero (placing blame
column17: etc.)
column18: I'm very grateful that this is the case - voice comms would be unbearable. This game resembles teamwork and even emulates it sometimes
column19: but unless you run with an outfit or a group of friends
column20: you might as well be playing alone.\n\nFriendly Fire and GriefingAlthough friendly fire is present
column21: it is inconsistent. You can be killed by teammates' grenades
column22: vehicles
column23: bombing-runs
column24: and mines
column25: but not from actual bullets. This
column26: again
column27: lends to the reckless zerging mob that rushes capture points.\n\nThe reporting system is exploitable and never there when it is truly needed.The current system consists of a three-tiered flag - green
column28: yellow
column29: and red. You need at least two flags from one game to be demoted from green to yellow tier. The next match
column30: you need to receive three reports
column31: or three yellow flags
column32: to move into the red tier. The red tier
column33: which activates in yet another match
column34: gets temp-banned after another two reports. The official wiki states "Green flags are not transferred from match to match. Yellow flags are removed 1 for every match you complete with a score above 5 and no Red flags. Red flags are removed 1 every 48 hours." I have seen people exploit this mechanic blatantly
column35: and nothing can be done with the current setup. Multiple times I have been the victim of this explotiation - as long as the griefer doesn't cross into the red
column36: they can kill you much as they want
column38: and then resume after the yellow flags are removed. The yellow flags are easy to remove
column39: as long as you have more than 5 XP from the match
column40: and you can get high as 200 XP just from being at a point while it's being captured. You only lose 10 XP for team-killing. At the end of the day
column41: they need a system that recognizes trends or something similar to PS2 where the player cannot fire their weapon if they have a certain number of grief points accumulated from damaging friendly players.\n\nPunishing the PlayerThe game has a built in filter for suicides. Suicides delay your respawn by a considerable amount. Methods for suicide include being killed by your own grenades
column46: and falling. I understand the mechanic - it is there to encourage safety and discourage recklessness. I feel like the word "suicide
column47:
though, really communicates something different altogether. I have never intentionally killed myself in this game, but I have had accidental deaths. I feel like the vast majority of people don't kill themselves in this game. There is no benefit that I can think of to suicide in H&G. Staying alive and walking to get whatever you need is always a better alternative. If you want to die, all you have to do is stand still in a capture point in the open - someone else would put you out of your misery shortly. Better yet, go look for trouble by walking into the enemies' spawn. Either way, this system is more annoying than anything else. My suicides in this game consist mostly of walking off a ledge about tall as my character while on low health and grenades. Keep in mind, I'm not saying that the suicides should be removed or that you shouldn't be able to accidentally kill yourself - those have to stay for the game to work. I'm saying that suicides for something like walking off a six foot tall ledge shouldn't count as a suicide. You wouldn't even need to check how far the player fell to rule it out. Have the server check the circumstance in which they died - did the player kill themselves or were they killed by another player? If killed by themselves, check the damage done to the player - should it be under a certain threshold to health ratio, let it be ruled a plain death instead of a suicide. Have weighted options for each circumstance surrounding the death (i.e., different damage thresholds for the circumstances). The logic is there, the rule is simple enough to add - it's just a lack of concern as far as I can tell.

CheatingAlthough at the time of this review the devs have gone to respectable lengths to implement anti-cheat systems, I still encounter the same cheaters, cheats, or exploits nearly every game. For the sake of the game, I will not list these exploits publically as I don't want the servers to get any more polluted. Although I understand the lack of a report system within the game itself as it would be abused, it would be nice if there was a more dependable way to report players exploiting the game. Again, I understand the difficulty behind this, but it really does dilute my fun.

RealismAlthough the models for the weapons, vehicles, uniforms, and sounds are spot on, the realism stops there. Beyond the aesthetic, this is just another FPS where stats matter more than common sense.

Pricing and the GrindI don't think that this game is pay to win. I do think that players that pay for memberships or buy gold are more apt to have an easier time leveling and acquiring weapons. Your paygrade scales with level, your required experience scales with level. After each match, the player has to pay to refill ammo for any weapons used, pay to repair any weapons or vehicles used. The price increases with the more modifications per weapon for both payments. On a losing match at the top of the leaderboard, I might net 5k credits for use in the shop. On a winning match at the top of the leaderboard, I might net 7k credits for use in the shop. The two weapons that you would spend the most time with as a German Infantry are the Bolt Action Kar. 98 and the MP40. I can't speak for the Kar. at the moment, but the MP40 alone costs around 128k to purchase. For a new player, that is a very long road.

The anti-tank rockets, such as the bazooka, cost 700 credits a shot. It takes at least two shots to destroy an enemy tank. Over a 30 minute match my side is winning, I might be able to destroy 5 tankers before dipping into my savings. These weapons are given to the new players at level 2 without providing this information - you have to go to the wiki to know many of the repair and refill prices - to wipe out any savings they might have had and coerce them to buy gold or a Veteran membership.

I have 750k saved up and am currently level 13 basically from min-maxing. I don't use modified weapons. I don't use grenades or vehicles beyond a certain threshold. I work the objective.

All this said, though, I still don't think it's pay to win. I feel that a large amount of this game is in general knowledge of stats, maps and locations, trends, and practice. I'm not saying that you need to be particularly skillful to outperform anyone, just know more than the guy you're shooting at.

ConclusionCan't recommend it. Too grindy with too little reward. (Also, text limit here. Sorry.)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is quite good in a lot of ways, unfortunately it fights tooth and nail to outweigh the good points with bad.

If you are looking for a simple drop in, kick around and get it done WW2 shooter, this is exactly the game you were looking for. Or not, because the cash and game economy are geared to ruin what is otherwise a very fun game.

Let me explain before someone comes up with the pitchforks and torches. Simply put everything in this game costs in game currency, repairs, upgrades, vehicles, the list goes on and on. Put more simply if it is in the game, you will be spending much if not all of what you earn from the in game economy on repairing it. If you go with only the most basic starter stuff, you can keep your costs down enough to actually build up a cash supply. This is because your economy rewards are based on time in match playing, not on things you actually do in match, and all your equipment and ammunition will eat into whatever you get from that at a very rapid pace. This means that unless you are spending large sums of time in match with nothing but the most basic gear you will not be buying or using any of that neat stuff you can unlock.

There is another way though. Everything, and I do mean everything, in the game can be bought for gold. As usual gold is the cash shop currency used by the devs to pay for their F2P title. Unfortunately the devs took all their cash shop and economy pages from the price gougers guide to pay to win economies. Not only can everything be paid for with gold, all the items locked behind the work of leveling and tasks for earning can be instantly unlocked with it as well. This, when combined with the extremely weak in game economy means it becomes quickly impossible to support anything but that basic starter gear, and makes the paying customers with their automatic weapons, bazookas, and Armored Personnel Carriers very obvious in every match you run into them.

Adding insult to injury, the gold itself is quite expensive compared to what you get for it.

On the whole, it is a good game, one I desperately want to like if not love, but I think not.

Early Access Review

Playing this game after 50 hours is hell. Imagine BF4 but downgraded by 1000000000000000. Yea this game is free but I'd rather pay the 20 bucks the game is worth than playing this game. The progression is super slow, so it's going to take a while to get guns and better vehicles. The only way to get around it is by paying for Gold, which is payed with real money. One of the best weapons in the game is more than 10 bucks... what? Yep more than 10 bucks for one gun, again sorry for comparing, but if you pay another 10 bucks you'll get BF4 which has no ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t Gold system and the progression is much faster.

Another thing about this game is the balance (btw balance is not even a thing in this game). The gun fights are fairly balanced however but the vehicles... just no... Tanks and planes are way to OP in this game since many people do not carry anti-armor weapons. This is because no one starts with anti-armor weapons regarding your class and the rocket launchers are SUPER expensive. There are some AA guns on the maps to take down the planes but it seems as if no one is using them... Side note: The American standard grenades are SUPER OP as well...

Another thing that factors into the poorly balanced game are the generals. Basically anyone who spits out money can be a freakin general. The role of these generals are to provide you with specific squads in each battle. Each squad has its own purpose and you can only spawn certain vehicles in each squad. Which leads to very unbalanced combat. I've had games where my team has had 6 tanks spawned in and the other team only had less than 3. Vice-Versa, I've  been on teams where we've have no squads to spawn in vehicles leading us to get pooped on (I kinda felt like the other team just finished eating bad truck food and they pooped out the spawn of Satin and made our team eat it).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Heroes and Generals is  a Pay-to-Win title from Reto.

I have been playing this game for a couple of years now, only to find that it gets worse with each patch.

If  you like unbalanced gameplay  with fanatsy skinned weapons where the team with most paying players have the supreme advantage,  then this game is for you.

Some typical scenarios you will encounter on a daily basis:

- Facing an opponent with tanks, planes and sniper while your team only consist of infantry
- Having your entire team camp because despite the dedicated recon class, everyone can buy a sniper and camp
- Glitching like flying people and missing textures when using a scope
- 450 ping servers after waiting in queue for 5-10 minutes
- Dying while exciting a vehicle
- Hitting a person, seeing blood but no kill (this also happens sometimes when you hit an object)
- 20 minutes of pure tank sniping while waiting for an impossible game to end

I woulld not recommend this game to anyone because investing time and money  into a game that's getting worse for each patch seems dumb

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really wanted to like this game, and I enjoyed parts of it for a while. But this game really has too many flaws to overlook the good things about it. There is definitley something of a p2w aspect, while it's overcomable on the Heroes side with skill and some luck it is much harder to excuse the p2w aspect when it comes to Generals. It takes forever to grind from Rank 1 to a Rank where you can turn your character into a General (look at my played hours, I still didn't get enough XP to level a General, but I got one single command point so I can control 35 Infantry). Or instead of grinding for hundreds of hours, you can just buy a General.

Some other issues I have with this game:
-When you're trying to join a match you can't look over your character build or change anything. You can't do anything but chat, and sometimes the queues are obnoxious.

-Matchmaking is funky. There will be matches where too many people spawn in tanks/planes or everyone is infantry even though there are tanks and planes avaliable to your side, and then the enemy is evenly outfitted with a good mix of armor/infantry/air.

-Matchmaking wouldn't be so bad if you could more easily change characters in a match. Mostly I say that due to wanting to bring an anti-tank character into matches where we just get overwhelmed by top-tier tanks and the rest of the team is full of new players.

-Matchmaking doesn't always mesh well with an RTS strategy of blocking certain lines because one side will have been matched to a game where they have 35 spawns from the attempted block and the other team has hundreds. Winnable? I guess, but it's like fighting as Sparta in 300.

-Spawn camping can be an issue, like most games. Spawning on top of enemies/enemies spawning on you is also an issue.

-Level design is average, because it has some fairly well designed stuff (like the Town overall is well designed), and then some not so well done stuff (like the factory level which they may be changing in the future). Their first Airfield map is fun, but suffers from too much open space where you're forced to use vehicles (so if your team is full of new people you'll be stuck with bicycles and old pickup trucks to get around while the other team will have motorcycles, jeeps, and APCs, possibly even tanks and planes!)  More trenches and/or fox holes would be both a welcome change and more realistic.

-Lack of a good tutorial level. The one they have is singleplayer and teaches you how to shoot/move, doesn't teach you about other gameplay basics from multiplayer. No tutorial/shooting range for tanks or planes so any person who grinds for a tank or a plane has to go into matches to just figure out the controls. The tank controls are fine, but the plane controls take some getting used to.

-Two Map Types. I don't really like King of the Hill type matches in general, so I don't really play those much. Their assault/defense maps can be interesting, but suffer from a lot of noobness due to the lack of a proper tutorial.

-Shooting people coming out of a vehicle takes practice because the animations for the transition between in-vehicle and stepping out of it aren't that smooth yet. (That's what I remember at least)

-Not enough sprint for the map sizes.

-Melee hitboxes need to be bigger

Did I have fun in this game? Yes.
Is is flawed? Definitely.
Other than the flaws it is a game I enjoy because, while it takes some getting used to, I think it's a good WW2 FPS that feels more realistic than COD.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you are looking for a free to play world war 2 game this not for you. It is no where near a free to play game especially for new players. I am an ironsight player from other WW2 games all the way up to modern FPS games and the sights for this game are just horrendous.

Map layout- The layout for each map are excruciatingly uneven especially with spawn points being steps away from a capture point. Spawn camping is a common occurence with high ranking players going behind the spawn and shooting those who have just spawned. Many maps are so uneven that if you get the good spawn that no matter how bad your team is you will still win.

Weapons- Starter weapons are starters they aren't the best but they should still be able to do damage, they kinda don't. Yeah they hit but they don't deal nearly any damage. If you want a new gun even a low tier new gun be ready to empty what little credits you get to get that gun and hope its good(whitch it isn't). If you use a gun or GRENADE too much you have to repair it. Yes you have to repair a GRENADE!!!!!! The expense of repairing a weapon  or GRENADE is about the same price as a new gun. So if you can't afford a new gun, you may not be able to even play the game.

Free to Play- Yes you can download it and play a few games for free. But if you run outta credits early on you may have to wait to even play. Or you can shell out money to play. I have played world of tanks, War thunder, and other WW2 FtP games and have never been bombarded so much to buy gold to even get farther into a game. This is no where near a free to play game.

Yes this is a beta so maybe it will change but right now it is very much a free but you have to pay to continue farther game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I would recommend this game to anyone who has a good aim, loves survival games, wants to relax and kill some noobs, or do some legit tactics with team.

Preformanse...
- personaly I don't have any problems, but i run a beasty PC build
- have a lot of friends with low to mid range PC who can't get 60 fps
- you will get more fps in BF then in H&G and BF has 10 times better visuals
- engine is very CPU demanding, but you have to account that this game was not made by some rich AAA company

Visuals...
- washed-out colors, foggy
- some people might complain about it, but i like the old style visuals
- think it fits with ww2, it gives it sort a bit of grim atmosphere
- also remind me on those old COD games

Gameplay...
- There are 2 paths to take, when playing this game:
- 1. value your life, relax, take your time, kill from distance, avoid avenging infantry
- 2. be aggressive, get into CQC to capture nodes, avoid and flank tanks and snipers
- usually new players run across roads and plain fields and then rage when sniper one-shots them from high ground
- game has 2 modes:
- 1. balanced staged battles: every side has same amount of spawns and same type of troops
- 2. unbalanced legit war: sometimes enemy can invest in better troops and more spawns and can be very unfair
- there is no better feeling when you manage to defend a city with enemy having 10x more spawns and better gear
- maps are huge and having positive K/D means to know them all

Movement...
- movement is floaty and prob not intended to be that way, but I must say i like it
- it brings new skill requirement to the game, i get a lot of kills just by knowing how to move when my opponent doesn't
- if movement were to be more responsive think i wouldn't die a single time in a match, this makes it difficult as well

Pay2win...
- new players feel like it's pay to win when they encounter 1shot sniper" (high damage modified sniper)
- it's posible to counter "1shot sniper" with defence badge
hoursPlayed: and best one: counter sniping\n- sniper battles tend to be rather fun

it can be very frustrating
- you have to always carry anti-tank mines and try to survive indoors in those situations or flank from whide angle

Grid...

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI really want to love this game, but I just can't. Heroes and Generals is a World War 2 FPS where players can be foot soldiers, airplane pilots, paratroopers and more. This game is not so fast paced and is more about taking a slow approach to attack your enemy and does have a little RTS twist.However,this game fails to suffice at many of these. This game has a good concept,but it doesn't work.This game is all purely pay-to-win. Let me sum it up. Firstly is the FPS aspect. Ranking up is hard and the game is unbalanced, players who pay more money get better weapons and the weapons are unbalanced, for example the MG-34 has the same accuracy, precision, recoil and damage as the MG-42 yet the MG-42 fires faster. This game also has RTS features, I am a HUGE fan of RTS, but in the game you have to pay at least 35 dollars to play as a general. Greed of the developers screwed up this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have one of about everything in the game, except for an officer. And it took quite a while to get that stuff as it was, you learned early that you play a bazooka guy and use that setup occasionally and use those rounds sparingly or litterally pay the price for the reload of ammo after the match. About half of the time here you see recorded I am a tanker and given that I still only have two med tanks and please don't get the Lee if you don't have a friend in it with you and you both don't have a sense of humor. The cash shop today is not what it was when I started, now I'm affraid you are going to at the very least have to pay for premium time, which is not over the top in price just to even get enough in game cash to buy things in game or ribbons to accelerate your soldiers progress exp.

As to P2W even now I would say that is not true, head shots w/ any weapon killl just the same. Snipers that don't take arc in to concideration won't hit anything at any level. People that don't burst their weapons and burn a whole clip on knowing the spray pattern gets worse the longer you lay on the trigger, well just get ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and rage that the weapon can hit SH#T!!! which even starter weapons do just fine once you learn how to use them. The only exception to this is the MG42 is a beast, at least it can't snipe like it use to.

The community has imho a lot of rage gamers, which is my biggest turn off. But given the amount of cash you get paid for a win vs. a loss you could almost understand it.

So to sum it all up

Positives:

1. Faced paced combat in fairly large maps
2. Graphics are good
3. Sound, use your sound and don't play music too loud it will save your life....LOL
4. Non campaign ques are short (you can play everything here you could in campaign)
5. Has in game comms, if you have a mic. (most don't use it though I don't know why)

Negatives:

1. Advancement w/o premium boost can hurt advancement
2. Community is a little hostile I would compair it to LoL (League of Legends) if you know that game
3. Still even today don't see the advantage at all to play campaign theater, no real upside. Community just get worse in        attitudes when they are losing. And you get no real feel or bonus for your side winning.
5. Campaign ques can take up to 10 - 15min
6. No punishment for quiters really  and you can lose a ton of matches that way 15 v 3 games.


So until they adjust the cash shop stuff again to make it more in balance with a true F2P ( And I do believe in supporting what you play as they too need to feed the family) I say keep looking.

Red Orcastra maybe Verdun? Or make sure that you play with at least 4 friends or more to make up some of the negatives listed above.

I hope this helped   :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game confuses me. Because it isn't badly done.

It's a f2p game, but it's mostly pay2avoidgrind. There are some p2w elements to it, but I've not noticed them have any significant impact on the game. You gain the free currency fast and unlock the gear quickly. I was in a tank with a big gun on it by my second night of playing. The interesting part is that the starter tank with a machine gun isn't actually bad. Infact, it's pretty good. You're essentially a metal box of anti-infantry that can park in any barn you want. It works well and you don't feel crapped on from above just because you're not shelling out money on unlocking upgrades quicker with real cash.

The weapons are heavily customisable and they actually make a difference. I have an SMG that fires so fast that at least one person has accused me of hacking because of it. Wonderful thing since i'm such a crap shot.

You can also steal bicycles and give people backies. Which is clearly a major selling point.

The game itself is very basic, there's not much to it. It's a WW2 shooter which feels to me like Day of Defeat on Battlefield sized maps. But it's nothing special, just a shooter.

But it has me hooked, I've no idea why. The game is average but the fact that it's a f2p game that doesn't feel like i'm forced to pay up to keep up has me smirking as i sit in my little tank gunning down anyone that comes near the cap point. I could use a bigger tank, sure. You gain currency just as quickly as you gain unlocks. But I don't want to, because everything in this game, from basic gear to bigger gear has it's place.

I'm still confused as to exactly what it is about this game I like. Maybe it's just simply because it's hitting all the right notes for a f2p game that wants to include a p2w element but doesn't feel like a monster grind or keeping me down because of it. Maybe it's because the game is barebones but feels like it has a lot of content to it and will only have more on the way?

Or maybe it's just because I can steal some American's bicycle for the glorious Fatherland.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Foreward:
I know the Dev's dont look at these reviews but please try and like it so that they can see this one.. I would like to see my favorite game get fixed.

Quick review:
This game was soooo soooo amazing once apon a time. What happened? Hope they get it back to the amazing vison that they once had. Maybe they dont care and just sold out their fans for a check, but I dont blame them we would all do the same right? I would not be the only one willing to pay to get all those microtransactions off of the game so that we could have a wholesome gaming experience.

1.8/10.0 was once a 9.4/10.0

In depth:
- Leveling WAS well balanced, you could level up without being forced to buy a trained character. Now leveling is so broken (or stratigized) that you have to buy a Luitenent if you want to try the second half of the game.
- This game was kind of cool and unique, not it is just another pay to play peice of garbage
- All the purchasable money and them trying to force purchases down our throats is immersion breaking...
- I used to love the days where you would spend money on the acutal puchase title and would get levels and items buy         earning them, even in game unbuyable money would work (example fallout caps).
- I loved this game and would have paid $34.99 to buy, own, play it even if it wasnt free (probably not the only one), I think what was done to make this game avaliable to the masses was its downfall and the reason it isnt more popular (look at minecraft, great game but doesnt cost any money).
- Speaking of minecraft, knock off games are made all the time now, if they dont fix it im sure someone will help us with a better game. Supply and demand!

P.S.
Please dont be too affended I just got off the game and was very frustrated by all the wallet warriors (other euphemisms here). You know what Im saying ;)

Early Access Review

Pros:

- Nice ambientation, sounds, graphics, weapon models...
- Fun to play till you get to lvl 3.

In my opinion is a nice game but bad made, they need to get out the P2W system or at least make it more balanced, make easier to rank up and get new weapons and stuff and make the mathes more balanced.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The publisher changes core game mechanics with every update. Some of the changes are minor, and some of them are game changing (read: game breaking). With the latest update named ‘Devyatayev – Squad’ AKA 'Squad 2.0', Reto has completely rewritten how the game is played.

I've been playing for about one year and logged around 300/800 hours via the client and steam respectively. I enjoyed the game through all the updates until now. The Devyatayev - squad update neglected to solve many of the old bugs and instead it has created a hostile player base while leaving many players worried that they (Reto, the publishers) either do not listen to players, or refuse to accept the overwhelming negative feedback from players. In my opinion this is not the game I once loved to play, it's now simply Squad 2.0.

I'll speak with my wallet and I choose not to support the developer any longer for this Early Access"."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have invested a lot of time into this game and have unlocked everything worthwhile including every tank and maxed recon perks. This was my most favorite game with everything I had been looking for in a ww2 shooter, that was until a recent patch made my favorite, the recon class all but useless with changes to the scope.

If you like sniping aka recon in H&G this is not the game for you. Unlike other games you need to invest a large portion of time leveling a basic infantry soldier before you can unlock recon. Once you unlock recon you are then able to use a scoped bolt action, this is great however the scope is so blurry and does not zoom in very far. You are better off trying to scout and aim at enemies using your binoculars then quickly switching to your gun and taking a shot hoping the target doesn't move as binoculars zoom in about 5 times more and is clear.

Previously the scope on the recon rifles were like that of the binoculars however with the recent patch recon is a waste of time.

If you want to drive a tank or fly a plane this game still has its up sides however if you play recon like me spend your 500+ hours playing something else.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Having played the game for quite some time now so I guess i will write a review.

Seems like alot of people complained and thinks this is a completely pay to win game. Well the most notable pay to win element in this game is the Badge and the extra equipment slot. As of the newest update everything can now be bought with credits. (Even Veteran membership and academy trained soldiers/ skins)

for me a war batttle lasted around 30 minutes can earn me 15k credits, with 26k credits you can buy a 15 rank academy trained infantry with high salary which will help you to make credits even faster.

this is a good start to make it less pay to win. if someone were to spent real money in this game they have to spent quite alot powerlevelling all those ribbons to max ranks to unlock those items not to mention then to buy them with gold. to unlock the heavy tank for example would need to spent over 25000+ gold and its totally not worth it now.

Second most pay to win element is the Strategic part of the game, the War is another different matter, it is about who has the most Generals/ active players = wins. With the introduction of bonus EXP and credits to war newbies are now storming War battles and it made it really unbalanced when stock infantry vs infantry full of smgs/ mgs. This needs to be looked at

There are also issues with people complaing about getting banned without any reason. Look for this topic about what software is prohibited.
http://support.heroesandgenerals.com/Knowledgebase/Article/View/19/0/prohibited-software

When they go to support it says they have been banned for cheating. The devs in this game takes this cheating business very serious, they have made it so when the game is running it will literally scans your PC to check if you are running any cheats on, so if you are running cheat engine to cheat on a flash game while Heroes and Generals is on, be expected that you will be perma-banned the next day when you log in.

As for gameplay I still cannot understand why the devs rejects the idea of having voice chat in game, they could also implement a mute button so for those who don't like voice chat they can simply turn it off, with the voice chat it can make the game better especially when you are working with a tanker/ communicate with your team. The game is sure fun but it is 100% not fun when you are playing and joining a match that is already half-way through, what this means is that when you joined and the match ends you won't earn any credits at all (This needs serious fixing since this happened to 6/10 of my skirmish games).


Then theres people who complained about the low FPS while playing the game. Well you actually do need to have a decent PC to play this, do check this link to check if you are capable of running it. Before I bought a decent gaming PC I was constantly getting 10-30 fps in the lowest settings and it is pretty frustrating. In the future hopefully the dev will optimize the game to be on par with other AA+ titles out there.
http://www.heroesandgenerals.com/community/game/user-guide/getting-started

Also to note the max player size currently for both teams is 36. Hopefully this will change in the future as it will definitely making the game more epic than the small battles we have now. Hopfully one day the British and the Japanese will be added to make this game alot better and it will become one of the very finest WW2 MMOFPS out there.

The tank balance in the newest update is now more balanced than before. Before Axis tanks literally is the worst in everything except Heavy Tanks and there are some errors which T-34-75 surpass the T-34-85 by 2 shotting most tanks while the 85 can.

The only problem i had with the current update is the introduction of scopes to infantry with their 1 hit kill rifles. This now makes it very unbalanced compared to a recon since playing recon now is useless. Not only infantry has more equipment slots they can also one shot people with ease and the only advantage recon has is a better scope and better mods. This has lead to massive sniping grounds in lots of War battles where everyone is just camping, not capturing objective and is just spawn killing everyone. As a result of this alot of new players rage quits.

As of now the game is definitely more playable and less pay to win than before. The game can be grindy yes but it is much better now with the increased earning rate plus the bonus to war. (before playing in war grant you no advantage but now people are actulaly playing war everynow and then).

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nA great WWII shooter than can be frustrating if you're new- less frustrating if you're a veteran. This game starts you off with basic weapons for any of the three factions you want to join- US, Soviets, and Germans. Each faction has its upsides and downsides, such as 4 bombs in a soviet plane, versus one bomb in a German plane, or the German MG42 with its 1200rpm versus all other machine guns. This game is viewed as pay to win by many, but it really is pay to progress faster. With 400+ hours clocked in this game, I have all the possible classes for Germany, all with high tier weapons and vehicles, and some soviet classes. I have not spent a single dime on this game as of yet.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This review got edited!

The game is not a new player friendly at all. My initial review was full of rage.

This is a very strange game. Not your typical shooter, hard, but once you get into it - over 100 hours - you will do just fine.

Read guides, watch youtube videos and you still will not know a lot about the game.

Experience. This is what you need. You need to learn the maps, you need to understand that this is a strategy game first, then a shooter. You need to learn where to be at what moment, after that you will enjoy it.

Few advices to new players:
1. Purchase weapons only after a good research. I have wasted tons of credits to go trough different routes and weapons.
2. Learn the maps and experience the game.
3. You need at least 1 hero to level 10 and one to 5-9 to say you know something. Before that it may be frustrating.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

WASTED POTENTIAL.  That is the basic summary of this game.  It's not early access.  It's been around since 2011/2012.  This game will never leave beta, as the devs don't want to lose that excuse.

This game is great until about 100 hours in, then you start to see all the flaws.  Things like a horrible match-maker (being put into games that are 30 seconds away from ending), garbage physics (a tank can flip if it hits a bicycle), bugs that are never addressed (spawn your tank upside down anyone?) and inept devs that rarely communicate with the user base and clearly only care about profit (raise in price for vet membership at same time you greatly nerf XP gains, then more recently nerf ribbon XP gain by a (user base) reported 75%?).  It's clear what these devs value.  Then there are the issues with the RTS side.

It's a real shame because the game concept isn't bad.  It can be quite fun, if your teammates aren't complete idiots that spend the whole round trying to snipe, using non sniper rifles (not just non-scoped rifles, but fools using SMG's and LMG's like they're snipers) or completely ignoring the objectives in the game.

*edit*
The devs scaled back the ribbon xp nerf after the tears and gnashing of teeth by the playerbase, myself included.  A definite +1 for the devs.  Wish I could say that more often.  I still think wasted potential is the best description for the game, but it's in a fairly playable/reasonable state right now.  Good enough for a free game.  Too bad I can't give this game a neutral rating.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Where do I start with this game?
Heroes and Generals is an amazing take on the WWII FPS area.

Only in Heroes and Generals can I wolf whistle my team mates into getting on the back of my push bike.
Only in Heroes and Gernals will I see a team mate kill himself 2-3 times trying to grenade tanks.
Only in Heroes and Generals will I spend hours leveling an infantry man to become recon, only to then be surprised how the rifle has a significant increase in cost.
Only in Heroes and Generals will I have an entire team of role-playing allies who make the game much more entertaining.

H&G is an amazing game, if you can cope with a few little nudges here and there.
And the best thing on H&G you ask? It's the only Free to play that's not a Russian learning simulator.

Heroes and generals is a ww2 based shooter that uses a more realistic combat system. In this aspect of the game it is fun, however the game quickly lost my intrest. I am a vertan FPS player and i have decent aim. i have many hours logged in various games and the biggest issue i have with this game is that it does not reward players well for there achivments. You make a set amount of money per hour. when you rank up u gain more money per hour but it is not much form 8000 to 18500 or so. the issue i have with this is the player who made 400 xp in a 10 min match will get the same reward as the player who made 20. the cost of weapons is way to high for the amount you have to play to get them.

Verdict: if you are bad at FPS games this game if for you.
BUT, if you are good you will strugle with getting money and probably get frustrated fast.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is great in theory. It combines FPS with the ability to influence the war in a RTS part. It has the protential to be an amazing gaming experience.

Unfortunately, it struggles to reach a status any higher than this. It had great potential when i first played it before it was on steam. I occasionally returned just to see that all the basic flaws did not get fixed or were made even worse over a period of over 2 years.

Biggest drawbacks for me (besides clunky interfaces, bugs and other technical issues that could be forgiven for a game in BETA) are: 1. The horrible grind (it takes very long to unlock troop classes, weapons, equipment, ranks), 2. The insanely messed up economy. You pay for everything-  used bullets, used grenades, vehicle repairs (only if you spent 100 hours to unlock them in the first playce lol), even if you use a scope you have to repair it for credits or gold after battle! The prices are also out of sanity. You have to pay nearly 100k credts for a bolt action rifle (and get like 5k max as a beginner per battle). Depending on your view it makes this game either a pay2win or pay2play. 3. The online game with the most unstable servers i've ever played. 4. It also has a very unbalanced faction population (get ready to get stomped by german faction a lot).

It's also very beginner unfriendly. You start with crappy equipment and get matched against people who play the game for a long time and have unlocked all the good stuff. And it is expensive and takes a long time to get on a somewhat even level. Until that point you basically get slaughtered a lot.

Also, the devs seem to like to annoy you and take stuff away from you. For example, a few updates ago everyone was able to take part in the RTS part of the game, buy som assault teams and send them into battle. Then they decided you have to grind out a general (which basically takes some 300 hours playtime or 50€ worth of gold) to be able to do that. Suddenly half of the game was locked away.
Or you grind to unlock a tank, you use that tank a lot, and they decide to put in a special ribbon for that tank that makes you have to unlock ammo types before you can effectively use it in war etc...

TL DR: The game can be fun if you don't expect anything good from it. If that's not your attitude, i don't recommend it

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great Game. Devs still have a long way to go to iron out annoying bugs and inconsistencies that the game has in regard to client side animation with server side damage registration. The multiplayer set up UI is horrible would love if they didnt use such an awkward process. If im in a squad and want to edit my load out or apply a change it pretty annopying i have to re-join a squad again to do so.

Also be nice if you could actually change loadouts in game most fps games allow you to do this why not this game?. Seems devs are creating their own model in the process of setting up and playing but seems they have forgotten people like the option to change things up mid-game play.

post-Rommel patch more ranks have been added to become General and Officer to deploy units etc. You are required to gather stupid amount of xp to get to these levels. It doesn't affect me too much since im not interested in deploying units or the doing the general side of the game.

Recommend this game because it is fun to play with your friends, but be warned if you enjoy games similar to this one such as battle field it takes a little bit getting use to but you won't regret it.
