reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is amazing. It's totally awesome. The gameplay is sensational. I really enjoyed it. The UI was a little clunky but okay, I could deal with it. It's a fantastic game. However.. The in-game currency system is a sham. You have to pay for EVERYTHING. Every single little thing you want to change about your character or even KEEP PLAYING, you have to pay. It's such a shameless method of the Developers forcing you to keep playing the game more! What's worse? If you choose a new career path after spending AGES getting to Rank 5, YOU HAVE TO PAY to change. This limits all your character options back to Lv.1 again. So you start from scratch, again. You also can't use certain weapons. So what if you wanna swap back to the career you've already unlocked?... YOU HAVE TO PAY AGAIN!! I've wasted 100,000 finding that out! You only get about 7,000 per game!! I am constantly taxed on every piece of this game. I olve playing it, but this is well enough to force me to stop. Let us play the F-ing game!!! I don't mind paying for things, but it's far too expensive and they should STAY UNLOCKED. Unbelivable. Ruined a great game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI would first like to say that I am not recommending this game at it's CURRENT state.This game really deserves a good review. In fact, it could've been one of the best WW2 games. I really, REALLY want to recommend this because I myself am a fan of FPS, Large-scale battles and WW2 and I was surprised on the variety of ww2 weapons and the skirmishes actually feel realistic and the feeling of needing to go prone in a field of heavy gun fire is amazing. Unfortunately, however, to get all the good stuff you're gonna have to grind..... a LOT. The game has a progression system so very slow that it is almost excruciatingly painful and after all the grind for experience. The weapon you worked so hard for is overpriced (92k for a slightly more accurate and lower rof version of the starting weapon). And a thing to note is reaching tier 2. Maybe you dominated everything in the first ranks with your modded grease gun or your accurate sniping with the Karabiner 98 and maybe you've gotten a lot of driving experience from your trusty GAZ and then you reach tier 2.... Holy ♥♥♥♥. Before you know it you'll get killed by a guy with an MG42 or get spawncampeed by a plane. The thing is that, this game has so much potential but a very problematic execution. Don't take this review saying This game sucks!" cause it is in fact good and I would support Reto into making this game better.I just want people to wait until this game is completely finished cause only then they will realize how great it is."

Cons:

Grind fest. Pay to win at it's best. Once news pay system came out it was too expensive to maintain weapons without using real money. You could use stock weapons but you want live long.
RETO!!! Not a very supportive DEV team. They look to be active in the forums but only really to anounce what they think you want or to ban you. They have banned a lot of people.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Previously wrote a review in which I did recommend the game however in light of the last update, I deleted said review in favour of this one.

I DO NOT RECOMMEND this game at all.

Developers felt that the already crazy grind (made shorter by spending real money for unlocks/veteran membership) was not making them enough money, so they now increased the amt of time by at least 75%, in some ribbon (perk/weapon xp) cases, more than 400%.

Why is this such a problem?

Well you see, there are many players who have been around since the beginning, or at least for a year, and in those builds, the time required to grind out certain NECESSARY perks, weapons, mods was a FRACTION of what it is today.

That means that you will get put into games where you're up against guys with fully modded out one hit kill weapons, top tier tanks, and most importantly gold level badges that give them a huge advantage over you.

What's that really matter, if I shoot someone with my rifle, they're gonna die, so who cares you say?

Well, that's just it....your gun will NOT kill them in one shot (unless you headshot them) where as their gun will kill you in one shot.  Even if you DO happen to grind out all the necessary experience to unlock all the mods required (and they cost a fkn ton of credits - in game currency- ) you STILL won't be able to one shot kill a lot of the vets" because they have the Heavyset Gold badge (a perk that allows you to take 15% less damage)

Well big deal

hoursPlayed:
right?

NOPE.  Only if you some how are able to cram in 400+ hours of game time into those 2 weeks.

Reto has literally gone full ♥♥♥♥♥♥ with this last update

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have nothing but praise for this game.  For a beta game it is FANTASTIC.  Far above COD and the Battlefield franchise in my opinion.  The game is very immersive and intense at times. The game does have some issues, but what Beta game doesn't?  If you're looking for some negatives, the hit detection is not always spot on (this has become very rare), sometimes you will be completely outnumbered, which isn't the developer't fault, it is the generals'.  As any game, it has things that you will love and you will hate.  Overall, this is probably the best FPS I have ever played.  I rank it right up in my books with COD 4.

People keep calling this game a Pay to Win" game.  It is not.  You can purchase anything from weapons to tanks

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Been gaming for around 35 years now and played alot of FPS and RTS games in that time from early medal of honour and call of duty right up to this game and im a big total war fan too. so when i found H&G over two and half years ago i was instantly intrested. Id never tested a game before so once id researched the game for a while i signed up for a closed beta key and installed the game.

At first it was all a little confusing but overtime i figured out how it all worked and became more and more engrossed in the game and was intrested enough to be still playing over three years later.The game has changed alot since those early days some of it good and some not so good, they have added alot of nice toys to play with and some cool maps to fight on although there are only a few maps compared to other games i thought its fine as i guess its easier to test a few maps rather than twenty or thirty so reto can refine their map building skills.

The one thing that changed the most for me is the grind at first it was easy to level up and build an army but as time has gone on the grind has increased to a point where its really hard work to get anywhere even for me having played for so long and can understand why so many new players have problems with this but things change over time and im hoping that Reto tone down the grind a bit but being an mmo and comparing it to other mmo's its not much different to those.

THIS PARAGRAPH IS OBSOLETE SINCE EVERYTHING INGAME CAN NOW BE BOUGHT WITH CREDITS BUT WILL LEAVE IT IN INCASE THINGS CHANGE.
(Alot of people claim this is a pay to win game and there seems to be alot of confusion as to what a pay to win game is, for me its a pay to advance quicker game over the time ive played it ive spent only a little bit of cash as im a low wage earner and dont often have cash to spare id say its around £50 in the time ive been playing which isnt alot but ive always spent my gold on vet status, i never buy weapons or tanks etc as they can all be unlocked by playing the game some people dont want to wait to unlock items but for me vet status is a better way of spending your gold and maybe a ribbon xp booster now and again and at the end of the day i will open those items sooner or later.)THIS LAST PARAGRAPH IS OBSOLETE SINCE EVERYTHING INGAME CAN NOW BE BOUGHT WITH CREDITS BUT WILL LEAVE IT IN INCASE THINGS CHANGE.

Overall im happy for the most part with the games progression new builds are always welcome good or bad as things that dont work or need changing do eventually get fixed or changed maybe not right away but as im in this for the long haul im ok to wait and let Reto make the game better and we nomally see new builds every three or four months which is fine with me.Cant say im 100% happy with everything reto have done but ive made my points of view clear on the forums which Reto do actually read and they do interact with people playing the game. they have even shown up in some of the twitch streams ive been watching.

As for cheaters and hackers since i started playing ive only come across one guy who i thought may be cheating he somehow knew where i was even though he couldnt see me he came round the corner and i was killed really fast maybe he was cheating or just knew the map really well and knows all the places people defend from but i trust Reto when they say that most cheat and hack reports are usually just players that are really good or new people who dont realise how the game works.

So if your gamer who likes a challenge and doesnt mind putting the time into a game and maybe a little cash i do recommend this game as it stands now yes it has its problems and some may say its been in beta too long but if your prepared to give the devs the time they need i can recommend this game. For those of you expecting to have everything unlocked in a week or two and a bug free game ( after all thats why im testing it) its not the game for you.

my apologies for making such a long review but i felt i needed too, to give this game the review it deserves as its clearly a game i enjoy playing.

P.S People seem to have a problem with the matchmaker which i get and the community have asked Reto to remove it but it wont happen,my advice if playing campaign battles its always better to join manually from the campaign map just check the resources for your faction first and make sure you have enough.

hope to see you in game

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am currently not recomending this game. Its gotten to the point that 8/10 times I try to play I end up getting extremely frustrated. There are a few rare games that get really heated up and fun to play that last over 30 minutes to an hour long. Faction weapons feel horribly unbalanced. I recently became a tanker with a German and found out that the default tank is SUPER UNBALANCED compared to the American light tanks. You fire infantry-grade machine guns at enemy Chaffees that two shot you. You'd have to play with another guy if you ever want to upgrade your tank (so that you can earn credits to buy a medium tank). This is just one of the many painstaking grinds that this game has to offer. I won't even begin with my struggle to become Recon... The only reason I have 152 hours right now is that my friend and I have a fun time playing it together.

Playing this game with a friend will make it fun and toleratable.  For example: He has a heavy tank and I use my recon class to go spot enemy vehicles for him as I implement Viet Cong Tactics to keep enemy units from reaching our cap point. We also have fun riding around in the Recon's Anti-Personal Vehicle (which I still don't understand why THE RECON CLASS IS ALLOWED TO HAVE). We play it every now and then for ***** and giggles until one of us finally gets tired of being ♥♥♥♥♥ by all the automatic weapons that the other two factions get.

There are three factions: Germany, Soviets, and the Americans. Germany I feel has horribly under powered weapons *cough* machinepistol 34 *cough* (does less damage than my c36 pistol :/ ) and I find myself having to pick up enemy weapons such as the AUTOMATIC CARBINES THAT AMERICA AND SOVIET RUSSIA DID NOT HAVE. The PTRD for the Soviets has got to be the icing on the cake because it can two shot my Anti-Personel Vehicle (skdftzz 222) which really doesn't seem right. The Russian APV is armored to the teeth but only has machine guns on it (which I believe is a good balance decision on Reto's part and I wish that they could implement that kind of balancing alot more often). All of these vehicles, weapons, attachments, ammunition all cost ingame credits (or a little-bit of micro-transaction) to purchase and maintain.

The final part of this game that both breaks it and makes it are the devs themselves. Reto-Moto is a development company that I believe is worse than EA. That has to atleast say something coming from a player who has witnessed this game since 2015 when I watched Frankie play it. Those were the days that they had actually envisioned great ideas and a train of development for that game that has such beautiful potential that is currently being hacked and slashed by a development team that censors more criticism than Nazi Germany in 1942. They repeatedly censor contrusctive feedback from the community, update the game with now useless updates (from the trailer which, of this review, features a new MG for the Americans and a nice nifty pistol for the German infantry to kill themselves with. I honestly have not had enough of that Johnson machine gun. That is a whole different topic that the community would give entire MLA formatted essays about just like the previously mentioned PTRD, auto-carbines, drunk sway motion held iron sights, spawn farming, etc. This game has multiple flaws that Reto-Moto has refused to listen about or fix and the majority of their community is outraged by the fact that the development of this game is coming to lazy standstill with hold off's like a new gun here and there or new camo or maybe a vehicle or two... It's sad to see a great game like this wasted by developers who show us that they're giving up on their game and milking it for whatever pennies it's worth. Don't let Reto-Moto set an example for Indie Devs. Don't waste money on Reto-Moto. Let Reto-Moto die.


P.S.
For sources about my claims" above with unbalanced weapons/vehicles

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is a very fun and competitive game. Yes, you can pay money to buy better weapons, but everyone can get these weapons if the game is played enough. If you choose to play the game by just sitting out in the woods sniping" like it's a CoD game

recommended:
or if you just run out into open fields. Understanding and using your stamina at the right times help as well.

A. People who hacked or use cheat software on their computers.
B. Players that played the game less than 20 hours and can't understand why they don't get the SNIPER RIFLE or all the best guns handed to them instantly.
C. People that play the game like it's CoD or CS GO.

Give it a try if you are mentally mature enough to understand those concepts. It's very rewarding once you've put some hours into playing."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Such an amazing game, a game were it demands you to use team work and use your surroundings as cover. Finally a World War 2 game which makes you feel like your actually in the war. There is a lot of weapons to choose from and classes which are the Infantry with normal assault rifles such as the M1 GARAND, the Tank Crewman which uses tanks in the battlefield, Paratrooper which comes in from the sky's and gets right in the action, the Recon which uses snipers from a far range from the battlefield, and the General which commands the war in which way to go and who to fight next.

You can choose which side your on when you start to play, you can choose either the Germans or the Americans. The Americans get the M1 Garand as the starting gun and the Germans get the Gewehr 43. You can then start to level up your character from there on and unlock new weapons such as the Thomson for the Americans. Just that you have to grind your way to the new ranks because it is pretty hard to level up, the best way to do it is to get defence kills by staying at your flag and getting kills on whoever comes to take the flag from you.

I would give this game a 7/10 just because there is some minor issues with the game, but hey it is in Beta stage.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I would normally never write a review but I think people getting into this game need to understand that the downsides to this game.  I am very conflicted on this review as it has good merits but I am going to give it a thumbs down for a few reasons I will cover now. I will include some of the things I enjoyed as well for those that want both sides of the coin.

- Prices on items are obscenely high and gives uneven advantages to people who pay (essentially Pay 2 Win)
- The current match making system is extremely flawed after you hit level 5 - I hit level 5 and was immediately thrown into repeated games with people that were almost max rank with Machine Guns, Tanks, Paratroopers, etc. while I was only using a small rifle
- You can be team killed or team kill by a bicycle bumping you
- You can run over a rock with a bicycle and commit suicide
- Players can suicide while driving a vehicle with you in it, causing you to commit suicide and have a long death timer (read below for inconsistency)
- Players can run into the grenades you throw and in return, give you warning points as well as lost experience/money
- Vehicles with mounted weapons kill you extremely fast and most of the time from extremely far distances
- Length from base to objective points will require a vehicle to be of use as a player (bicycle, truck, jeep, etc.)
- Grenades almost always one shot people even when a decent distance away
- Disliked the water physics and how it would screw any vehicle that entered water, even if the vehicle was above the waterline
- Lower graphics than most standard FPS
- Extremely disliked the repair cost, again trying to force you into paying money

This is all I can think of currently. Now for the positive aspects.

- Enjoyable as a casual FPS game
- I found nostalgia in this game, making me miss the old Medal of Honor
- Good fluid motion and gameplay
- I loved the effort put into players exiting vehicles, you basically roll out of the car and come up shooting
- Loved the indicator on the grenade to show where it would go
- Loved the iron sights and swaying, as well as how the stamina effected the stability
- I loved the creative addition of the bicycle, it made me laugh to tears when somebody team killed me accidentally while ringing the bike
- Loved the maps and the creativity put behind it
- I liked the physics behind vehicles

Due to the demanding aspect of the game that really tries to force you into paying, the poor match making system and (cannot fault the game for this) the lack of players for higher ranked games forcing me into constant red ping, I am going to give this a thumbs down.  If it wasn't for these three aspects, I would love this game and tolerate the other minor aspects.

Sorry.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've been playing this game since closed beta, but stopped playing it a few months ago. Now that I saw it on Steam, I decided to give it a try.

The game improved a lot. Graphics are better, level design looks really good and they improved some of the new maps and added new ones.
Weapons variety isn't great, but at least they added new ones prior to the Steam release.

Only problem I have with this game is that the movements feel weird. It's like it has some kind of input lag, keys feel unresponsive. Not sure if it's because the game mechanics, or really an input lag, but as this never improved since closed beta, I believe it's intentional, though I think they should tweak it. I understand when you character runs, it takes some time to stop, as it does in real life, but how it works in game feels really weird.

I recommend the game as I had hours of fun playing it. My favorite part of the game used to be being a pilot and bombing the f* out of tanks. I'll try to play it again just to see what they did to flying.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Joined 2 weeks ago, Liked what i saw, bug's well documented in other reviews, but is a ww2 game with mixed unit action so can overlook a few bugs,  then todays patch came out, and BAM....10,000's complaints, log in errors,  they patch the patch, still errors and a game breaking new idea of NOT letting you change class during a game, are the dev's listening to the players.? = NOT A CHANCE.!

What a pity, this could have been the game i was looking for, but its badly managed by the dev's,

I have spoken to a LOT of vetern players in these past two weeks and everyone without exception has said the same thing,  its on a downward spiral... i'm never one to listen to gossip but after todays 9 waisted hours trying to log-in/play, i can see what there all talking about,  patch's should be tested before being released into an online game, had this been tested these problems could have been fixed ahead of patch launch........very very sad to have to say this as i have never given a neg review,  but i DO NOT RECOMMEND as it stands.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Before this game came to steam, I believe it was in beta, but to us it felt like the full game.

It was so much easier back then, you could be a hero and simply kill whoever you wanted to and you could also have assault teams, which was the half the reason I wanted to play this game... You see, I had an ambition with these assault teams...

I wanted to create a Home Guard for the coast of England, I had it all planned, bookmarked a webstie that had all the units. I was gonna go ham. Within a couple weeks I created two units: 1 London Platoon and 7 Falmouth Company; I still had a long way to go but I was determined to cover the coast.

Eventually I stopped playing the game for a while, but when I came back, I saw this horrific mess that was made but most importantly, the inability to create assault teams as a hero but now you need to be a General.

Why did you do this H&G?




Why? :(

reviewText:
Early Access Review

REVIEW


# indirect Pay-To-Win
The game uses the same PtW mechanic like WoT / WoW. You can easily level up but once you get the modifications for your gun the repair costs will kick in and you won´t make any more money to buy other guns, upgrades, modifications. All your money goes into repair / restock. The only thing that helps is a payed membership.

# False incentives
The game forces players to play tactical and go for the capture points / objectives instead of mindlessly killing the enemy. This is actually a good thing but it is badly executed. Quite often players who defend an objective on the outside perimeter do the actual work, helping teammates to capture the point. Especially players with a high K/D do the major effort to secure and hold areas, roads, paths, houses so that the team can progress. Unfortunalty these people fight and die outside the capture zone and do not get the sweet bonus which you really really need to pay for the repair costs.

This forces you to either play with an unmodded gun to save money or the buy a veteran membership" which will grant you more bonuses (progression
recommended:
etc...)

# Not a Strategy Game
Despite this game features a map of europe signaling players that this game is more than just fighting in staged arenas
hoursPlayed: the truth is
voteText: that so many random factors (army composition
helpfulPercent: loadout
votesHelpful: weather
votesTotal: skills) which players can not control leads to a dominance of veteran players with their armies
votesFunny: deep pockets and the newest thing: Squad play which results in random guys fighting a pre-mate group with up to 5 (that´s what i saw
commentsCount:
but i bet even more players are possbile) and just destroy them.

# Spawn Camping
Spawn points are more or less fix and enemy will use it to kill you the second after you spawned. Reto developed some system against it that you are invisible after start but that leads to rediclious situations where enemies spawn behind you or right in front of you.

# Cheaters
They do exist even though the people on the forum will tell you that they don´t and that it is all skill.
When people instandly turn 180° because you spawned behind them; when people shoot you half across the map
column16: when the aim of people is switching rapidly
column17: when the players aims at you though he can not see you
column18: because he aimed at someone else and the field of view was so narrow
column19:
when they know you are coming through the door and have their crosshair trained on you.... after roughly 20 years of FPS gameplay i know when i see a cheater. This game makes it just harder to detect someone because of the OHK weapons.

# Camping
This is a valid tactic but gives you only kills and no objective = points. You might even help your team because you are defending or just killing enemies but the rewards for kills is too low in comparisment to capture points.

# Balance
While real war is not balanced and you might be outgunned against an enemy - in this game you can not even switch the loadout during battle so you are stuck with your rifle but you are fighting on a city map and a submaschine gun is what you need. Or you prepared for CQC but the enemy uses tanks. GG

# Shadows
A good idea poorly executed. Because of the shadows in this game you can stand 2 meters away from the enemy shooting his MG42 but you won´t the see body only the gun firing. People
column20: cars
column21: tanks
column22: weapons
column23:
everything can become invisible in these shadows. It is broad daylight and you won´t see anything because of the difference between shadow and light.

I strongly do not recommend this game!!!
Like other people said in their reviews. Reto (developer / publisher) does so many unnecessary changes and tweaks to this game to make it feel like a rock hard game and then offering you a membership to ease a few of your problems.

Do not play or buy!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I see a lot of negative reviews from people that have spent less than a hundred hours playing this game, I can understand their frustration but people need to understand this isn’t your regular FPS war game.

This game, in my opinion, is a FPS MMORPG, which i’ve really enjoyed playing and grinding my way to Level 10 Recon. You don’t see people playing WoW and complaining about spending hundreds of hours to get the highgest level and best gear possible.
If you’re not prepared to grind for your levels I suggest you go play Counterstrike (no offense intended, I enjoy that game myself). However if you are interested in a refreshing new take on a WW2 FPS then give this game a go.

I’ll be the first to admit that there are commerce issues, the upkeep of munition and weapons is too high and the price tiering for weapons is too steep. All games have their issues and I strongly believe these will be sorted.

Regardless, I had a huge amount of fun when I started with my GEWEHR 43 and now I have even more with my fully modded Kar98k.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

An alright game. Nothing spectacular that makes it stand out.
Then again, I'm seventeen hours in and am stuck on the deathmatch style matchmaking, rather than the world at war style one.
It's a heavy grind, which I imagine is a way to try to subtly push players to spend money to buy gold(Premium currency), despite the fact you get four premium currency every day if you play a match, win or lose.
The largest issue from the game is that fact is has an estimated thirty hour 'tutorial', (This is estimated based on grind. I'm on level 4 and the full gameplay style is available at 5. I'm 17 hours in.) unless you pay for an academy trained soldier, who is locked in their respective field of training.
The game would be better if the artificial barrier were removed, or even lowered.
I'm not finding it worth the time you have to put into it to get anything out of it.
All together, I'd give it a 4/10.
It's not utter trash, but it's more of a job than a game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So here i am writing a review....

Well if you dont want to read this entire view than here is the short anwser, this game is ♥♥♥♥ in its current state.

I really liked the idea of a WWII shooter with an RTS element and at first I enjoyed it.  When I first joined I thought the game was really fun and intresting so I kept playing (I have played for about 500 hours on another account) untill I realised how much of a grind it really is. Badges (The progress system) take forever to unlock so getting new and most importantly good weapons take ages, unless you buy gold like I did.  Not only does it take long time to unlock the equipment, getting the money for them requires the same level of grinding.

Next up is balance and this is a big one. The devs suck at balancing their game. They have more intrest in making good/OP weapons super hard to get for free players but if you pay a huge amount of money you can unlock the badges for that weapon, however than you have to spend more money to buy the bloody gun itself. Anyway back to balance, there is very little. There are two game types, war and staged battles. War battles are controlled by what is going on in the RTS side of the game which sounds cool, but they are extremely unbalanced due to most battles having over welling odds stacked against you like tanks however I can forgive this due to the game trying to make a realistic war setting. Staged battles are the balanced" side of the game with the amount of tanks
date: soldiers and planes being the same. However this mod is affected by the unbalanced weapons and tanks in the game
recommended: for example a American Hellcat is a tank hunter (That is its tank class) and it is far more deadly than a German Hetzer which is also a tank hunter.\n\nLastly is the maps themselves which are very boring and sometimes pretty unbalanced. As well as this most of the game is just broken. For example the prone mechanics dont work
hoursPlayed: scoping in when prone often results in the scope spassing which causes you to get killed in most situations.\n\nThe only positives from this game is the concept really.... so sad that devs have become this greedy and lazy."

Well try playing it and getting to rank 6, after that good luck because you need to grind for atleast 100+ hours to get something good, plus the devs don't care about the players, they are hiding behind a mask and it might look like they do but they don't.
Another BIG issue is the balancing and it is terrible, your team might not have tanks and the enemy team has tanks, the same for planes and everything else.
Also this is a pay to win game, Why? Well because the money you are earning is not near enough to buy anything, you get like 3k per game and the basic meele weapon is 15k, not to mention the sniper rifle which is about 250k so you will have to but gold with real money and spend it, if it was only for the looks it was ok but it isn't, you pay for guns, rifle, lmg and basicly... everything, the only thing that you don't have to pay for is the civilian car and bike that spawn near points, you even have to pay for repairing your weapon and buy ammo. Plus you have 3 factions and the items that you buy doesn't share between the factions... and if you look at the reviews and the rating you'll see that its probably droping because people are starting to realize that this is a pay to win game with a lot of bugs and doesn't worth your time and your money.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game has a ton of potential but unfortunately has just gotten worse with every update. I would not recommend a new player start playing now unless they are willing to spend hundreds of hours and/or a good amount of money to unlock the necessary equipments to be competitive. It took me 200-300 hours to level my Soviet up from 0 to 9 without paying any real money (Max level is 22).  If you're good, you can unlock weapons faster, but that doesn’t mean you'll be able to afford them. Unlike XP, salaries are paid out per battle based on your rank and have nothing to do with in game performance. So it doesn't matter if you won the game siglehandedly or were afk the entire time. As long as you complete at least 50 percent of the battle you get paid. On top of that, you also have to pay to maintain your guns, vehicles, explosives, and ammunition. Many times you will be put over budget" because you utilized to many of the items you worked hard to unlock and pay for
date: causing you to loose money. I cant use my best gun and anti tank grenades because one has a fast ROF
recommended: meaning I have to pay for a ton of bullets. And the other cost an arm and a leg per grenade to the point were if I use more than 2-3 I'll loose money. The devs take every opportunity to milk money from you. It cost money to change classes and then on top of that cost more money to buy the equipment to actually use the class. Noting in the game is balanced well
hoursPlayed: including the factions. The Germans have by far the best weapons and vehicles

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIm sick of developers ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ the bed. There are so many concepts which are perfectly painted and so damn simple, but turn out to be buggy, unpolished, pay2win, and a complete grind. This game fills a few of those categories. The painful thing about H&G is that it easily could be great. When alone, the mechanics of this game, including both weapory and gamemodes, are great. Balancing nonwithstanding, if you are a player committed to overcoming the grind and leveling up, you would enjoy this game. But once there are tanks to be fought, unbalanced slugfests of armor running your character over and over again, while you have no acess to anything to remotely damage a single tank, you will lose satisfaction. and at this point in the game's development, it seems like that isnt going to change. It makes me sad, almost angry at modern game companies that grab for cash like this. Again and again, titles such as War of the Roses, War of the Vikings, Rome 2 Total War, Planetside 2, and Heroes (Horrendous) and Generals (Grindfest) show mechanical potential, but disappoint the vocal majority of their players. So I implore you; do not buy into it. do not reward a game company's trechery.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Not sure if I should Thumbs Up or Thumbs Down this game, so I'll just write a list of pros/cons and then choose depending on what list is bigger.

Pros:
Large scale battles on big maps
Extremely well thought out character progression
Unique classes and buffs
Great selection of weaponry and vehicles
Personalised soldiers that you actually care about
Different game modes
Access to nearly everything using in-game credits won by playing
Modify every gun with unique mods that affect its performance. Repair these mods with in-game credits
Choose your faction and tell your friends because even though the teams aren't permanent (they re-set every week) you are locked into your faction choice until the war is over.

Cons:
Can be very laggy if you are placed in a foreign server
Maps are massive and if you have no transport it takes ages to get anywhere
Good weapons are expensive and may take several days to aquire if you are short on play time
Can be very buggy as it is in Beta
If you are up against an enemy team with Tank classes and you don't have any then the game becomes extremely unbalanced and one-sided.
There is a griefing" system where if anyone does even 1 team damage to you
date: you can press F1 to automatically report them. Sensative ♥♥♥♥♥es report everyone for everything resulting in bans.\nYou can wait for up to 10 minutes just to get a game only to have it load and inform you that you have to quit.\nThe weapons and equipment you buy with the credits you earn free via playing are extremely expensive. Example; the American BAR 1918 costs 128700 credits. A rank 3 player earns under 2
recommended:
000 credits for playing a game. Games can last up to 30 minutes or more. It takes a VERY long time to unlock anything useful without spending real money.
Pay 2 Win
Tanks/Snipers beat everything
Very basic tutorial that teaches you how to shoot.... that's it. No menu/classes/progression tutorials
Totally unnanounced server maintenance that occurs often in-game
hoursPlayed: resulting in 0 experience or in some cases losing experience.\nIf your Assault Team runs out of "lives" then you are forced to quit the game

so you can't really lose. However be aware it may not be a smooth game experience until you get into the swing of how things work. After a few more updates and general balancing this game will be very highly recommended.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is special!
Let me first say that the historicall information is By far the most accurate Iv'e ever seen in a free2pay game!    Im glad to see how were sticking to the facts, this game is a testimant to germany's victory over the allies in ww2.
I didn't realize that during ww2 humans thought that Filling their pants with wet cement was a good idea for war.    allbeit it would be interesting to see what armor that they would supply but sadly you dont get the chance to find out,
Because in the time it would take for you to trip over in the 50 pounds inside your pants You have already been shot  from across the map by a tank shooting through fog as thick as a Brick wall.

The most historically accurate information i learned from this game is the surprisingly large amount of people who had lew garrages disease who were enlisted durring WW2, The aiming and movement are Superbly accurate in in account.
Also the super realistic frictionless soap bars ( AKA as Tanks ) are the only way to move from spawn to the battlefield.    But to keep it fair Everybody is given RPGs to use and are readly available at any time you see a tank or a man on a bike
There are many Types of tanks such as small tank ,medium tank ,big tank & bigger tank.
With 4 Months of trainning and play time, you to can advance to the small tank!

The complex team play is another key feature of this game, Caputring key points and more points.
You and your team can comunicate through Hi-Quality text, As any good tacticale FPS knows, text is most important way to give commands in the heat of battle!

This Games realistic emursion made me feel that I too was a man durring the second world war with lew garrages disease and cement in my pants.

-good on ya devs

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nBeautiful idea, okay concept, but all that running just to be sniped, blown up by a tank that your team has no means to destroy, or shot by a camper because he (and their team in general) lack the incentive to defend/attack a position just kills that gameplay. Expect many one-sided games, gameplay that consists of running and wondering where you are, and a lack of any weaponry that can actually kill someone accurately (the higher-level guns will instantly kill you btw). Don't get me wrong, this game was kindof fun at first, but as you progress you....lose the ability to progress unless you buy up. Finally, the bigger battles especially have LOTS of issues with bugs and lagging. So much so that I had to delete the game entirely. Honestly, don't get this game. It isn't worth it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A cool idea created by 15 years old horny teenagers that can't balance, can't design, can't ensure good performance (strong fps), and ultimately, can't make the game non p2w because of all of the above...

Yes, technically speaking, this game is a ww2 clone of say, Planetside 2, in some of it's respects (combined arms)... but they have taken every possible mechanic in the game and broke it (they did fix planetside 2's lag, but maps are 100 times smaller so).

On the surface, the game's premise looks decent. You have a series of progressively increasing maps that are decently sized and at first glance, look like they provide enough cover... Nothing could be further from the truth. The bigger the map gets, the bigger wasteland it becomes. At the end, at the biggest maps, you might as well be figting in Saudi Arabias Deserts with pine trees scattered throughout. No cover, no damage at any reasonable range by your weapons (even with a scope), a building here and then 500 meters later a building there, the checkpoints always in the middle of a bloody wasteland that you can't traverse without vehicles that arrent available anywhere, checkpoints that are a total of 5 meters squared and bombs that are damage 314 meters squared (10 m damage radius).

It would be a sad excuse to call people that made this game developers. It would be a lie. They have no clue what they are doing, the only decent decision they made in the whole game is to enable headshots for the rifles from most reasonable ranges. Everything rest in this (formerly) p2w game (but still effectively p2w in many respects due to the completely broken game mechanics) that had it's free cash per hour increased 4x times yet still being too slow to grind is more or less awfull.

So much promise, soooo little delivered in the end, like the vast majority of todays cookie cutter games. Saddest part about all of this is just how little it takes to fix more or less every issue i have with this game (just tweaking the damage settings so it stops being unbalanced (and a slight p2w) and tweaking the stupid maps so they stop being wastelands, i could manage the grind).

A fail of a game whose only decent mode is depo (the first and smallest map). They should have stopped development there...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well I've clocked a lot of this game... Got really annoyed after about 3 weeks - 2 months of playing it and decided it wasn't worth my time. Came back to the game hoping it might be different, only to realize its even more money driven than before.

If you want my honest opinion. Don't bother. You'll probably drop a significant amount of money (excess of $20) to get anything good or fun. And by that point you mine as well have bought a different game cause the graphics and play experience aren't worth any dollar amount (in my opinion).

For that reason have to give the game a

2/10

Reasons:
-Developers aren't interested in gameplay (you have to buy bullets with your hard earned in game points or gold (bought with actual money))
-Gameplay is medicore for a FPS (Red Orchistra or almost anything else looks cooler)
-Time required to earn anything is too much for the grind to be fun (and someone else could just drop money and beat you there)
-Having better equipment is a HUGE advantage...

If you're looking for a good WW2 game, get Comapny of Heroes 2 or something. But don't waste your time with this game. If you do want to check it out and try it, download it and play a little ( It is free to start). But don't invest any money cause you'll be disappointed you did after about 5-10 hours.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nMassive grind and heavy pay 2 win. Every other guy has fully upgraded bolt action rifle that kills with single hit in the torso, but you have rifle that sometimes won´t even kill with headshots (if they have badge reducing incoming damage(NO JOKE)). Movement is clumsy, you have to unlock and buy everything for each soldier separately.For example, you have SMG, and your soldier progresses and you buy him a machine gun, you can´t equip another soldier with that SMG even if he have it unlocked, so you are 1 gun lying in storage. Game economics is a joke, you pay for your ammo and weapon/vehicle repairs, and if you are AT soldier, even if you are using own rocket launcher strictly on enemy tanks (no shooting at infantry), you still end up LOOSING money, because what you get for tank kill is not enough to cover the cost of rockets used. They say you can buy almost anything with non promium currency, but that paywall will hold even white walkers. From july 2014 they added 1 faction (USSR) and strategic map (and some gamemodes) is Germans vs USA vs USSR. This game is wrong at many more levels, but you get the idea, so don´t even bother to download that 1,3 GB, or  buy yourself some other game, because here 20 € is not enough for some guns, you might want, and they will even charge silver or gold money for ammo and repairs.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has/had so much potential, but the devs throw it away to make a quick buck.
Many will tell you this game is not pay to win since you can unlock everything (since the W-Bulid) with credits (standard ingame currency), which is true, but it takes you ages to unlock even the basic stuff like a jeep without using real money.

I have never seen a game with a bigger grind then this one, then again I think I havent played many grind heavy games, but I think 1200 hours speak for themselfs.

Unless this game changes drasticly, which I belive it WONT, I see no reason continuing playing.

Disclaimer: I was in a clan and had alot of fun playing with those folks until I realised that those guys where the ONLY reason I kept playing this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Lets do some grind math real quick, average mission time 53 minutes, average payout per mission 4800 credits, cost of a new weapon 92280 credits. That translates to about 17 hours of in match game time for that new weapon assuming you and your team perform above par and you win every single one of your matches. Not only that but all the parts and ammo you can buy to make your gun perform differently are going to need constant credit infusions to keep working. Don't leave now theres more! All that grind is just for your primary weapon, so you burn maybe 35 - 40 hours to get that gun and all her mods. by then you have already unlocked access to the straight up better version of said gun WHICH IS EVEN MORE EXPENSIVE.

Now that im done talking about my third job, lets talk about how the game runs.  Graphics got lost in 2005, net code is back there with it as well. The menu, squad, and friends system don't just need work, you flip a coin at launch to see if they even do work. Anyone out there have vision problems? Expect white text over white backgrounds and poor advanced graphics options. Game is only free to play because they know if they asked for money and showed it to the public no one would buy it.

Verdict 3/10 Game not only barely works, it slaps you in the face with your computer.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

-Grinding. Everything is grinding from unlocking, buying, upgrading and maintaining weapons/vehicles/badges/classes.
-They made griding credits a bit easy if you sink 50 - 100 hrs IN MATCHES (thats right not including those match making time) but they really made grinding ribbons hard now but don't worry you can now use credits or gold which you could buy using real money to immediately get upgrades or ribbons you want with prices that is more expensive than the most expensive guns in the game.
-I will defend the game is not P2W but paying will give you a little edge on someone who is not paying.
-It is common to encounter a frustrating match (tanks blowing you up 5 secs after you spawn, no one is doing objective, deploy queue because all your teamates are camping because they dont want to be in the deploy queue, getting in a match that is so hopeless you will wonder why did you wait 5 mins so that the game would put you into that match, your class that are using to grind its weapons is not available in the match or run out of spawn, you have 5 dumb pilots and 5 dumb tankers which are basically dead weight)
-Did you love the trailers of this game like the soviet one? too bad you still need to wait 20 years for that.
-Not battlefield kind of gameplay. Which means more realistic spawn location and spawn time. Battles in open areas are skirmishes with few assault until attacker gets tired and just camp in their point.
-Finally if you are not dedicated enough this game is not for you, without paying anything 10 - 50 hr at least would be required for you to get the play of this game and be familiar to all the maps.
-If you still reading this and interested in the game PRO TIP DO NOT PLAY ON AIRFIELD AS INFANTRY or you might loose interest of this game immediately that map is for tanks and snipers just practice on skirmishes maps for a few hours.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

(please add me +200 hours from the non-steam release)

TL;DR Wasted potential. Dead development.

Heroes&Generals despite being a good alternative to Battlefield series with a great not too fast/slow pacing (that I enjoy way more than annoying BF chaos) is a giant waste of potential, all thanks to it's devs. The development is dead as clearly unfinished mechanics (very shallow tank/air combat and RTS gamemode) haven't been significantly updated since I started playing (addition of soviet faction in febuary 2015). Reto-Moto is currently milking players by adding more and more camos/skins and overpowerd weapons/vehicles (that in 90% nobody ever really wanted) to buy (price too high for grinding these).

The player-developer communication does. not. exist. The development feedback section on forum is filled with detailed suggestions and constructive criticism. All of this is getting ignored by devs. There are almost no developer responses to these posts. Also devstreams are disappointing and the part dedicated to answering players questions is based on drawing a random question from twitch comment section.

I really want this game to succeed but seeing the current situation I cannot recommend this game for today.
voteText: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I decided to test how much it would cost to buy the best gun in the game (m1/m2), so I threw 20 dollars at the game and bought a new character. It takes 20 dollars to GET ENOUGH EXPERIENCE TO BE ABLE TO BUY THE GUN. THIS IS WORSE THAN PAY 2 WIN BECAUSE THE PEOPLE WHO WILL PAY CANT PAY ENOUGH. THE GUN ITSELF IS WORTH ANOTHER 20 DOLLARS. I played a match exclusively using rifles on another new character to see how hard it would be to rank all the way up to the M1/M2.

You would have to get 7000 kills with the m1 garand in order to unlock the M1/M2 carbine. I averaged 8 kills per game. Thats 875 games. Each game can be as long as half an hour.

In order to unlock the best weapon in the game I would have to play 437.5 hours of this game

8.9/10 -IGN

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At first the game is pretty fun.  A decently designed strategic first person shooter. Then you play for 4 hours and wonder why you only gained 1 level. There is a simple answer. They want your money and it's a damn shame they will ruin your experience to get it. I would have payed for new game modes, faction additions, or anything else they offered to add. However they decided to allow players to pay for every abilty, item, character, vehicle, etc..., and in doing so, the xp grind to unlock everything by playing normally is atrocious. Since the game is going to take you over 24 hours total to get your only a fraction(even this is an overstatement) of your abilities, items etc... without paying, its just not worth the effort.

TLDR; Infinite Grind makes the game unplayable and is driving away every sane person that was interested in playing.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game does have potential to get better, but in its current form I don't recommend it.  It is your basic pay to win" formula.  As a free player
date: you start out with your minimal 1 to 2 weapon combo
recommended: and must grind for hours to be able to upgrade to new equipment.   Meanwhile those who opt to pay real money are given access to better gear
hoursPlayed: faster experience/credit rewards
voteText: and an extra badge slot (which basically allows for an extra ability).  I did have fun for the first few hours playing map after map as an infantryman saving up my money to upgrade to a pilot.  Once I reached pilot rank the game took a completely different turn (for the worse) in "dogfighting" mode.  I've played several flight simulators in the last 25 years
helpfulPercent: and I'll just say that this game needs some work on the flight system.  The controls are simply awful
votesHelpful: not to mention there is no tutorial mode for flying.  Being up against "paying" players with superior aircraft
votesTotal: my plane was gunned down numerous times usually in less than 30 seconds.  Turning is almost impossible
votesFunny: and the beginner plane seems to not be able to outrun anything.  After each match your plane suffers damage
commentsCount: which takes credits to repair as well as credits to resupply your ammo.  After several matches as a pilot
column16: I decided the pilot path wasn't for me...but as I tried to go back to my regular infantryman
column17: the game wanted to charge me credits to do that.  This is where I decided to stop playing the game.  I may come back to this game in the future if they further balance the gameplay and decrease the edge the "paying" players have over the "free" players."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is the most direct example of pay to win I have ever seen. You have to use gold to purchase vehicles and the vast majority of weapons. If you do not buy gold, you will earn a couple each win, which means you will only need to play a few hundred games before you can afford a new weapon.

Additionally, Veteran membership, which can only be bought in gold, gives you an additional passive bonus, and an additional weapon. Do not give them any money, unless you support pay to win.

If I could give it more than 1 thumbs down, I would.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If your looking for that World War 2 game feel and quite can't find it, I strongly suggest you give this one a go. By far the best WW2 FPS shooter out and it's only getting better. Sure it has it's bugs and fixes from time to time but don't all games in Beta?

The game has many diverse elements in it from sniping on the ground, From Dog fighting in the sky or Blowing SH!T up with tanks.

I've Spent a great deal of time playing and i can reassure you if you like status going from level to level, unlocking gun after gun this will keep you busy for some time.

It's Not pay to win like you see in some games. You earn any gun you want.

In my many hours of experience i've never come across one hacker either.

So if you got spare time give it a go and tell us what you think...

Cheers

reviewText:
Early Access Review

so where do i start? First off the game looks great for whatever engine it is running, it is also understandable that the game is in beta/early access and a lot will still be implemented... I am giving this a thumbs down for now since it is far from being finished and the fact that the cons outweight the pros...

try the game out. im pretty sure you will love it up until you pass level 3 and/or encounter these issues more and more...

Pros :

If you are looking for that WWII feel, one where you and your buddies can feel as if you are part of the inglorious ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s, or part of the team of FURY then this game will most likely put you on the right path, it has nice maps and i feel they are made nicely and seem pretty balance where no other team will dominate simply because its better for them starting on whatever side of the map they are...  Sadly that is the only Pro for this game so far...

Cons:

PAY PAY PAY... although it is possible to get pretty much anything with the ingame currency you will have to force yourself to grind grind and grind some more just to get that upgrade. (note the higher you rank up the more credits you get). like every P2W game anyone with the cash to blow will always out power you. The slow climb to power (weapons and vehicules) will always leave you on a disadvantage...

Balance is so far an EHH factor since 7 out of 10 matches i played one team out number the other with tanks and planes, which results to a quick end game, fastest round i played so far from start to finish was 3 mins.

Dont expect to be able to upgrade your weapon like you would in todays FPS games, there is no scope attachments or suppressors, but you can upgrade the triggers, barrels and so on (the little things) YOU ARE STUCK WITH IRON SIGHTS!!!! until you unlock the sniper rifle, which you can get once you reached the RECON class, which is some way away and would take anyone some time to get unless you pay with real money. same goes with the upgrades... You will forced to bus the Veteran pack membership if you want to level up faster which costs 2400 gold that you have to pay for with real money and there is no option to buy that much gold so you are forced to buy more gold than you need, which is about 4700 gold for 19.95 Euros below that it is 2200 gold for 9.95 euros...

The hit boxes and damage effects is another thing thats messed up at the moment... for example i snuck up behind a tank to place these Anti Tank grenades on it, for some reason the gunner saw me, how? i dont know since the pilot and gunner have a very minimal point of view (dont think Battlefield when i say limited i mean you can look a few degrees to the left and right, and see next to nothing since the scopes you look through is way to dark, makes you wish for night vision) anyway then the gunner jumps out and starts shooting at me, at this point i already places the ATG on him so i ran for cover, as i reach my cover i turn around to see the gunner standing right next to the tank and i watch the tank explode in a massive explosion and i watched the gunner just stand there in the brunt of the explosion with not a care in the world and just kills me with one shot (note i had full health)...

Damage, like ive mention above this seems to be off by i dont know how many factors, forget the invinsible tank gunner for a second and lets go to the weapon damage, you start with the standard rilfes of each faction, The US using the M1Grand, Germany  Gewher 43 and the Russians the SVT40... then you get a sniper riles one unscoped and one with a scope (scoped can only be purcashed once you reach RECON CLASS or with REAL MONEY). now damage can be upgraded by upgrading your weapon like the Trigger, Barrel, Sights, Ammo and Internals which is the bolt or spring...
I have the russian sniper rifle which is the Mosin-Nagant 1891 upgraded for maximum damage and for some reason it still take more than 2 shots most of the time to kill someone, which others seem to be getting one hit kills by shooting you on the leg while you have full HP... Could be hacks or could be there is something that i am missing? who knows..

Objects have rough edges there are countless times where i find my weapon aimed perfectly at someone and clearly nothing in the way of my weapon and ones i shoot POOF invisible wall saves his life...

Example i saw a guy proning about 50 meters from me. which is an easy kill, he was looking my way but was busy shooting at someone else, i had a perfcet shot on his head since he was proned and it was the only thing i could see of his body, so i lined up my shot places my sights right on his head and took the shot, and of course invisible wall saves his life. so i line up again to take another shot since he didnt see me yet. i fired, and yup you guessed it invisible wall again, so i move a little to the left *note he is on higher ground so all i can see is his head and it is the only thing i can hit, so standing a little to the left now i took another shot at his head, but instead of killing him (with my maxed out damage upgraded scopeless sniper rifle) all it did was damage him even though i had a pefect shot at his head). He saw me as a result of this shot so i take cover behind a boulder and started to reload my weapon the all of a sudden bang i get hit with a headshot, so im like F**k someone was behind me. buuuut noooo it was the same guy according to the killcam... and this has happened a bunch of time on different matches and maps... latency issues? hacks? unsmooth edges? who knows...

There have been an extreme amout of BS deaths that just makes you stop and wonder like WTF HOW? but then you just stop and think the game is still in BETA and there will be issues, but once it happens often you just stop and think ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥T!!! the game is still good though if you have friends to play it with, i wont recommend it if you want to play it alone at the state it is now, you will just spend most of your time wondering how the F**K did he manage to kill me like that or how the F**k did i manage to do that...

Jumping in the game is also broken, most of the time the command does not even respond and when it does you will feel as if you are playing Counter Strike with gravity off, you jump high and it takes you a while to get back down, ive gotten a bunch of kills like this, it makes for easy targets...

Match Making is also another headache, which results in unbalance like mention above. if you make a squad you are stuck on the squad page, so everytime you want to make a change or an upgrade you will have to leave the squad and make your changes and get reinvited back in... a pain in the ♥♥♥ if you are the squad leader...

If you leave a game you have a lock out of a few mins from the looks of it, kind of like in NOSGOTH...

All in all the game is good aside for these things which kills the fun to be honest but the game is still Beta and i will stick around to see the finished product, but for now it gets a thumbs down until these issues are resolved.

Including the unbalance, this game is reall really really bad when it comes to balance, there are no words for how unbalanced this game it... i fly Russia, and ive never been in a single round where there were more than 3 pilots on my side, worst balance i ever had was 3 pilots vs 11... 11!!! like is i said, there is no balance in this game, one side will always out number you with tanks and planes!!!!

To sum it all this is like playing Day Of Defeat/Battlefield... only it is unbalanced because of the P2W factor and because of the issues ive mentioned.
voteText: 11 of 16 people (69%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First off, this game is HEAVILY pay to win!

With that said, the gameplay is fun, the controls are responsive and the assault team / generals system works well. That's about all the good stuff I have to say about this game.

Everything that can be bought in game (and I mean EVERYTHING) is absurdly expensive, most of the maps are god awful, the battles are majorly unbalanced and I have noticed the odd issue with net code (almost as bad as it is in Battlefield 4, but not quite).

So, imagine this. You join a battle, but the enemy team has tanks. Well you can just get your own tank right? Nope, once unlocking that it costs over 20k credits to get the basic tank, and that doesn't even have a cannon. So, just give your soldier an AT weapon? Nope, again, it costs a ridiculous amount of credits.
So quite often you end up going against heavy armour and cant do anything else about it. Sure you get the odd AT weapon that spawns on the map, but they spawn in the most stupid places, like out in the open for example.

Most of the maps are so open it's not even funny. They all seem to favour either snipers or vehicles, which you'll be grinding for hours and hours before you get either one of them, oh my bad, you can always pay REAL MONEY to get them early.

So if you can get past the crappy maps and the unbalanced teams, there's the people who have actually paid into the game. You then have to deal with people with one shot kill weapons, better vehicles and a certain badge that gives you more HP. There's probably a lot more stuff you can buy to **** over people who aren't dim-witted enough to give this piece of trash they call a game any money, but honestly I gave up at that point.

Conclusion:
Don't bother with this unless you like unbalanced games and having to pay real money to get anywhere or having to pay to have fun. Like BrazillianSoldier said in his review (http://steamcommunity.com/id/Brazilian_Soldier/recommended/227940/), buy Rising Storm/Red Orchestra 2. It's very similar to this, only you pay for it once and you have the whole game, no having to deal with and damn pay to win crap.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAs of currently, I can not say I like what I see. Even for a Beta, this game is quite broken. Though Gameplay is the only one that isn't broken to my knowledge, but it's the loading, the buffering, the waiting, it's too long. I mean, I expected this to be basically Planetside but in a WWII Era, instead I get a Battlefield Free to Play. Though I'm not arguing on that subject, I actually don't mind in the slightest. But the fact that I had to wait nearly 15 minutes just to get to the main menu and an additional 5 minutes to get into a game, I rather just update Planetside 2 and play that. And after the game was done, I got to the point where I could unlock / buy weapons, and that broken too, everytime I buy a weapon it doesn't respond, I keep clicking and I never unlock the weapon. Again, I can reason it being a Beta, I should expect some issues, but this has been out since July and it's nearing the end of August, I think there should of been plenty of time for this to not be an issue for future players like me. I want to enjoy this game, but with the waiting and the non-response of the menu, I can't exactly say I'm impressed nor makes me want to come back. What's the point in waiting nearly half an hour to play one game when there are other games like it that are not only polished but finished to where it can take me just mere seconds to play a game. Maybe when it's officially released" I may come back to see if it's been improved
recommended: I'm more likely not coming back."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI first was in love with the game it was fun to play and fair. But as more players with more experience than me in the game appeard it became less enjoyable. The level of fairness dropped dramatically for they were using IRL money to buy IG money allowing them to get expensive upgrades. I could not do this for one of my parents was unemployed so we did not have the money to do that. So i decided i would work hard and earn the IG money and buy what i wanted. But as i finished games i saw that the amount of money u get is miniscule while everything u could want to buy which is major in price. SO in the money category this game fails. The maps are also set up in a way were there is no CQB area it is mostly open fields. Making it impossible to do anything but die as a Submachine gun class which i am. I also played a recent game of assault in which we the attackers had all the objectives ut one. this one was surrounded by vast openess while it had excellent cover. So the losing teamwas able to just sit there and snipe us while we tried to get close. In the end my team which had all but one objective lost because we ran out of lives. The gamemodes all and all make no sense and is basically CoD team deathmatch. All in all this is just a lower quality CoD Ghosts, do not waste your storage space or time getting or playing the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's just not good. I played a lot more on my old computer, then I go and get a new computer and the best frame rate that I can muster is about 20. That's with everything down and the resolution set at like 800 by 400 or whatever it is. It looks terrible, and won't run right at all. It's not optimized even in the slightest bit, so lego laptops beware.

It's also just not fun. It's a terrible depiction of world war two. Everything just seems off. The towns feel like prop towns, like they're made out of cardboard or something. They just don't feel real. The actual gun play is terrible and reminds me of games I used to play about ten years ago. Not to mention that you either use the starting loadout, or you pay real money to get anything else. ANYTHING ELSE.

It's just a terrible game. The settings are bland and empty, and the gunplay feels terrible.

If you want an amazing world war two game. I highly HIGHLY suggest spending ten bucks on red orchestra osfront, and dowloading the darkest hour mod. It's absolutely amazing. This game on the other hand.....I'll leave that blank

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If a World War II game actually makes you feel like youre actually in a War, then the Developers did a great Job. This is what happend to me. Considering the fact that you have to capture flags isn't realistic at all. But this isn't about realism.
Those type of moments where the enemy comes into a house with 3 or 4 people and youre the last survivor who must defend it are just great and satisfying. Although it sometimes ends up into grenade spam, where everyone throws their grenades in your room. But to be honest this doesn't bother me too much.

Im going to split this into two parts: Pros and Cons. I will also talk about the different aspects about Heroes and generals: Audio/Atmosphere, Gameplay and Graphics.


Graphics
There's not really much to say. The graphics are just average. Nothing special but it fits to the game. They could improve a bit but honestly im already fine with the graphics. The weapon and car graphics are the best graphics in the game so far. The soldiers all look the same. There's no variety between Soldier A and Soldier B except for the tankcrew or the paratroopers for example but all of them have the same faces. Its not clone wars.

Audio/Atmosphere
The Gunshots are really great! I mean they are just perfect compared to other games like CS:GO. On the other hand the distant Gunfire shots are horrible at Mid-Range. If someone shots a rifle 40 meters away from you, you will hear it. In this game, you wont. At least its not so easy. I cant really say much about the Tanks because i played this game for 9 hours. So bare in mind that this is an early review.
If no one is shooting or driving you can hear absolutely nothing. There is no wind or Animal sounds. Just nothing.
In the games menu where you can customize your soldiers you will hear the games Soundtrack over and over again, which can be annoying.

Gameplay
Like i said Above the fights are just intense and satisfying. The game itself is very easy for me because i already have a KD of 1.85 after 9 hours of playing. If you are new to the game the objectives are pretty easy: Capture the flag. Just like in WW2.
There are microstransaction in Heroes & Generals but it doesnt affect the gameplay. At least not for low-level battles. The matchmaker is pretty good in this game but sometimes you have to wait 90 seconds till the battle starts.
Let's get to the Campaign map". Yes the campaign map you got me. Heroes & Generals is also a strategy game.
The map itself is europe with every single city on it. But i completely ignored it at the start because for low levels like me this map is totally useless because you have to be a Corporal to fight on it. Anyways Generals or Lieutenants can start battle on it and YOU as a soldier can fight on these battles! Want to fight on the battle of Berlin? You can do it
date:
if youre level 5.

Pros
+ Very good Battles itself
+ Immersive
+ One of the best Gunshots sounds ever
+ Capture the flag: Just like in WW2
+ Very easy to learn.
+ Customizable Soldiers/Weapons/Appearance
+ RTS Elements

Cons
- No Atmosphere if nobody is shooting
- Battle may turn into Grenade Spam
- Only a few Maps
- Distant Gunfire is Awful
- No Variety between Soldiers
- The Map design is really wierd sometimes

My personal Verdict:        7
recommended:
5/10
It's a great game and theres literally no reason to not download it because its free!
PS: Don't hate me for my Grammar.
PSPS: Thanks for reading this review :D Youre awesome
"

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Yes the game is free, and the videos they have on its steam page make it look great but take a few things into account before you buy it.

First off, this game looks nothing like it does in the videos you most likely just saw. Those videos are made to look way way better than what you actually get when you play the game. The graphics in the game are decent, but they could be better. The tanks, cars, and guns are done pretty well as they show a good and accurate amount of detail to what they really were in WW2. The soliders and maps are where things start to decline. The maps in this game all have the same sort of greyish - brown texture. The trees could have been done much better, as they look like 2x4s painted grey and the bushes look like poor cutouts of a pre-schooler. The soilders aren't the best either. The character model is the same for everyone across all three of the factions. All of the models have the same creepy, face that stares at you and that doesn't change even after being shot in the back of the head. But, to help their poor character models, they added different types of camos in the game so you can stand out yet blend into the map as you go into battle. The only problem is, that the camos are $$$, which leads me into my next point.

This game is free to play, which usually translates into pay to win. Not always, but usually. Unfortuantly, this game is 100% pay to win. Unless you have FPS experience in the past, you will have a very hard time starting off with the first guns they give you. Even after you have been playing the game for awhile or are used to playing FPS games, they are rather hard aim with. Each of the starter rifles for the 3 factions are the same in many ways, Each hold limited about of ammo, each have slow rate of fire,  and each have poor iron sights. This will make it very hard for players to be able to enjoy the game at first, and get credits ( ingame currency ) to get better weapons. But, after 1-2 days on the game, you get enough credits and buy a new weapon and you go try it out ingame. When you finish, you come back to being in DEBT becaus your weapon needs repairs. Repairs in this game are COMPLETLY unnecessary and a way for the game to suck away your money. The idea is that you need to repair your weapon after battle, but that idea  sucks money away from you very quickly. But, you still like this game, so you get past it and keep playing the game. You spend some time on the game and find yourself with a new weapon, and at the same time find yourself not being able to make credits. This is where the veteran membership comes in. The veteran membership is a small buff  that makes you level things up quicker, rank up faster and gain more credits. If you want to make a very good amout of credits in a day, you will need to have your accout a veteran member. All the rest you will figure out very fast. The badges, weapons, cars, and tanks in the game take a very large about of playtime to unlock, ( unless you buy gold ). So... the game is a grind, it doesn't look the best, and is pay to win, but its fun right?

The gameplay of the game is one of the few things that is good about it. I have had a very good time playing this game, but there are still things that need to be fixed. First, the movment. For a long time, moving in this game has felt very floaty. There was a recent patch to fix this, but there are still times where it feels you are on iceskates trying to turn a corner before you get killed. The shooting in the game is good. Its a classic aim down the sights and shoot game,, but you will need to do one thing, which is get a basic understanding of the maps. As said very breifly before in this review, these maps are WAY to big. Its not quite at the point to where its an open world game, but its like CODs NukeTown times 100.

There are still many things that need to be inproved about this game. In the end it depends on who you are. If you know the basic FPS lingo, give the game a shot. If you are new to FPS on PC, you might want to try a another game

6/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The legend of Heroes & Generals

Long long time ago - when dragons ruled the sky - there once was a developer who created a game. He was very happy with his game, so he first released its alpha version soon followed by its beta version and steam launch, still fully bugged, with an ancient graphic and with unstable servers, but with a beautiful idea of the ultimative WW2-game, close to perfection. And he decided that he will work on this game hard, releasing patches and bugfixes every month, so his game could become beautiful and some day go out of beta and become playable, finally a good and a well balanced game. But.... the dark times have come. The developer becomes sick on mind - the bad and the ugly ones tell he becomes greedy. His sickness drowned him into darkness, and he was no longer the same. He forgot about his creation, leaving it on a cold stone deep in the mountain cave. The game, lying on the stone, cried for a first time, and all people who put their hopes in it cried with it.

The time have passed, world has changed, mordor faded away long time ago and everybody forgot about the game. The developer grew old, probably died or hidden somewhere in the great forest, in fact nobody knows. The game itself is now lost, noone cared about it for a long time, and it lays in ruin, being slowly consumed by the sickness of its creator. The legend says that some day someone will find that cave, take out the game to the daylight, fix it from the bugs that are poisoning it and flooding its veins, and the people will give their hearts to Heroes & Generals once again.

But, that's only a legend....


_________________


Finally I love this game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWhile I agree that certain things in HnG don't make sense and are fairly stupid. And the fact that the devs are pretty slow at their job. It is still a pretty good game. Don't get discouraged by the grind, I have a Recon with a OHK k98 and never payed a single dollar. Granted it did take me about 3 years of on off playing, but now I have one, and a fighter pilot AND a tanker with the Panzer IV. Once you get all that stuff, you can laugh at the other people who paid money and just started with the same gear it took you 3 years to get. And on to the axis, allies and soviet thing. I have never played a single second as anything but Axis. Axis stuff is not OP! We get the best tank(how often do you see heavy tanks in a game?) and thats about it. Everything else is pretty balanced. The allies get the E8 which was a heavy tank irl, and it steamrolls Axis medium tanks. Every game I play, the thing that says we win or not is teamwork. Without teamwork games suck and we get steamrolled. From what I see on the Axis side, is that very rarely does the other team work as a group. When they do work as a group however, the game is fun and can go to either side. Yes there are way too many people on Axis. But when I joined the last war, there were only about 50 less players on the allied side then Axis, and the soviets had around 200 to 300 less than Axis. Could be because nobody really wants to start from scratch on the soviet side, or because teamwork doesnt exist. I will say its probably a combination of the two. and for my final overview. Axis, Allies and Soviets are all about equal. It is not a P2W all that does is make the grinding time faster. OHK guns exist on all sides. All in all its a fun game and you should get it. Glory and Victory.
